original: chos la sogs pa'i 'khor lo rnams la mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bsgom zhing zhal dang sna bug g-yon pa dang bshang ba'i sgo dang sna bug g-yas pa rnams la khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams dang / rna ba g-yas pa dan @41a * //
analyzed: chos la sogs pa'i 'khor lo rnams la mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bsgom zhing zhal dang sna bug g-yon pa dang bshang ba'i sgo dang sna bug g-yas pa rnams la khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams dang / rna ba g-yas pa dan @41a * //
translated: Meditate on the dakinis and so on in the wheels of the Dharma and so on, and Khaṇḍarohā and so on in the left face, left nostril, anus, and right nostril.

original: g-yas min dang mig g-yas pa dang g-yas min rnams la gshin rje brtan ma la sogs ba rnams bcug ste /
analyzed: g-yas min dang mig g-yas pa dang g-yas min rnams la gshin rje brtan ma la sogs ba rnams bcug ste /
translated: Place Caṇḍālī and so on in the right ear, right nostril, right eye, and left nostril.

original: spyi bo la sogs pa rnams la sngar bzhin rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / de dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i so dang sen mo la sogs pa'i khams kyang nges par bya zhing bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma'i gsang gnas dang / de'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang bla ma'i gdams ngag las shes par byas la /
analyzed: spyi bo la sogs pa rnams la sngar bzhin rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / de dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i so dang sen mo la sogs pa'i khams kyang nges par bya zhing bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma'i gsang gnas dang / de'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang bla ma'i gdams ngag las shes par byas la /
translated: As before, place the twenty-four nāḍīs in the crown, and so on, and also the elements of the teeth, nails, and so on, in union with them. The bhaga of the Bhagavat and the Bhagavatī and their union should be understood from the guru’s instruction.

original: bdag nyid dang sna tshogs pa yang bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du bltas te ji ltar bde ba rnam par spyad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang sna tshogs pa yang bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du bltas te ji ltar bde ba rnam par spyad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should view oneself and the variety as having the nature of great bliss and enjoy them as one likes.

original: de dag nyid nye bar sdud pa de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid nye bar sdud pa de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The summary of those is “thus” and so forth.

original: de ltar gsungs pa'i lus kyi rang bzhin ni dpa' bo ste sangs rgyas thams cad dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa'i lus kyi rang bzhin ni dpa' bo ste sangs rgyas thams cad dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the nature of the body is a hero, equal to all buddhas.

original: 'di dag gang gi phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di dag gang gi phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: For what reason is this?

original: gnyis med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, “nondual,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin de stong pa dang gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang bstan to zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin de stong pa dang gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang bstan to zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Because of the nature of great bliss, the stage of the inconceivable buddhahood is taught by the yoga of nondual emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang gi lam nyid bskyed pa'i rim pa spros pa'i rim pa bsgoms pas ting nge 'dzin yang thob par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang gi lam nyid bskyed pa'i rim pa spros pa'i rim pa bsgoms pas ting nge 'dzin yang thob par mi 'gyur na /
translated: For that reason, if one does not attain samādhi by meditating on the creation stage, the stage of elaboration,

original: gang la slar yang sangs rgyas nyid de rigs ba dang lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la slar yang sangs rgyas nyid de rigs ba dang lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradicted by reasoning and scripture.

original: de ltar yang re zhig rim pas bsgom par bya ba /
analyzed: de ltar yang re zhig rim pas bsgom par bya ba /
translated: Thus, first, one should meditate in stages,

original: rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin lha du ma'i 'khor lo brtags pa'i tshul la sems brtan par byed pa /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin lha du ma'i 'khor lo brtags pa'i tshul la sems brtan par byed pa /
translated: stabilizing the mind in the method of imagining the wheel of many deities, the nature of the support and the supported.

original: lhan cig la yang skad cig gis rdzogs par lhag par mos pas bsgoms pa na /
analyzed: lhan cig la yang skad cig gis rdzogs par lhag par mos pas bsgoms pa na /
translated: Then, when one meditates on the complete form of the deity in a single instant,

original: gang gi tshe zhal bsgoms pa de'i tshe phyag la sogs pa bsgom pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhal bsgoms pa de'i tshe phyag la sogs pa bsgom pa med de /
translated: when one meditates on the face, one does not meditate on the arms and so on.

original: de ltar gang gi tshe phyag la sogs pa'i yan lag gzhan dang gzhan bsgoms pa de'i tshe zhal la sogs pa bsgom pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi tshe phyag la sogs pa'i yan lag gzhan dang gzhan bsgoms pa de'i tshe zhal la sogs pa bsgom pa med do //
translated: And when one meditates on the other limbs, such as the arms, one does not meditate on the face and so on.

original: ma bsgoms na yang zhal la sogs pa gsal ba ma yin te rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni cig car ma yin no zhes skye bo thams cad kyi rang rig gis grub bo //
analyzed: ma bsgoms na yang zhal la sogs pa gsal ba ma yin te rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni cig car ma yin no zhes skye bo thams cad kyi rang rig gis grub bo //
translated: And if one does not meditate on the face and so on, it is not clear, because two thoughts do not occur simultaneously. This is established by the reflexive awareness of all beings.

original: de gang las zhe na sems rtse gcig ba'i mtshan nyid ting nge 'dzin rnam par rtog pa du mas 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gang las zhe na sems rtse gcig ba'i mtshan nyid ting nge 'dzin rnam par rtog pa du mas 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because the concentration that is the characteristic of one-pointedness of mind is disturbed by many discursive thoughts.

original: gang yang sangs rgyas nyid ni bsod @41b nams dang ye shes kyis tshogs kyi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gang yang sangs rgyas nyid ni bsod @41b nams dang ye shes kyis tshogs kyi 'bras bu ste /
translated: Moreover, buddhahood is the result of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de ji ltar bsgom pa tsam gyis 'gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ji ltar bsgom pa tsam gyis 'gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: How could it come about merely through meditation?

original: dbul po 'ga' zhig bdag 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'o zhes bsgoms pas 'khor los sgyur ba nyid thob pa dang / yi dags bsgoms pas yi dags nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbul po 'ga' zhig bdag 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'o zhes bsgoms pas 'khor los sgyur ba nyid thob pa dang / yi dags bsgoms pas yi dags nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If it did, then by meditating on himself as a universal monarch, a poor man would attain universal monarchy, and by meditating on himself as a hungry ghost, he would attain the state of a hungry ghost.

original: gang gi phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las 'bras bu dang bral bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las 'bras bu dang bral bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that virtuous and nonvirtuous actions would be devoid of results.

original: bsgoms pas yul cung zad gsal bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: bsgoms pas yul cung zad gsal bar 'gyur mod /
translated: Granted that meditation makes the object slightly clearer,

original: de lta na yang 'dod pa can gyi 'dod ma'i rnam pa gsal ba ltar dus skad cig tsam rjes su 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dod pa can gyi 'dod ma'i rnam pa gsal ba ltar dus skad cig tsam rjes su 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but even so, it would be connected with the object for only a moment, like the clear aspect of a desire realm object.

original: brtags pa nyid kyis brdzun pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: brtags pa nyid kyis brdzun pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: because they are false by nature, as imagined.

original: de nyid ma yin pa'i mngon par zhen pa las byung ba nyid kyis 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams ni de ltar mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ma yin pa'i mngon par zhen pa las byung ba nyid kyis 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams ni de ltar mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, mundane things are impermanent, arising from the notional attachment to what is not real.

original: brtags pa'i rnal 'byor ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams las kyang shin tu brdzun te /
analyzed: brtags pa'i rnal 'byor ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams las kyang shin tu brdzun te /
translated: The yoga of imagination is even more false than mundane things,

original: kha dog dang dbyibs dang bral ba'i sgra la sogs pa rnams kyang de bzhin du des sgom par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs dang bral ba'i sgra la sogs pa rnams kyang de bzhin du des sgom par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cultivates sounds, etc. which are devoid of color and shape.

original: gang yang gsal bar gyur pa dus skad cig tu gnas kyang dgos pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang gsal bar gyur pa dus skad cig tu gnas kyang dgos pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Even if the manifest were to endure for a moment, it would be purposeless.

original: gzugs can rnams ni so sor nges pa'i yul dang dus la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams ni so sor nges pa'i yul dang dus la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the material things are fixed in their respective places and times.

original: khyad bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis 'gro ba'i don la nye bar mkho ba'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis 'gro ba'i don la nye bar mkho ba'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a special cause, because it is not endowed with the qualities of superknowledge, etc. which are necessary for the benefit of the world.

original: khyad pa ni rnam pa de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa dag go //
analyzed: khyad pa ni rnam pa de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa dag go //
translated: The difference is that they are endowed with the above-mentioned qualities.

original: gzugs can ni khyab par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs can ni khyab par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The form body is not pervasive.

original: bum ba yang khyab par byed pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //🔽gal te yang gang bsgoms pa de kho na gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bum ba yang khyab par byed pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro // gal te yang gang bsgoms pa de kho na gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that the vase would be pervasive.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.

original: de ji ltar gzugs sna tshogs pa'i nor bu bzhin du gdul bya mos pa tha dad pa du ma'i mngon par 'dod pa rnam pa du ma cig car rab tu gsal ba de yang 'dod par 'gyur ro //🔽de nyid kyi phyir gdul bya mtha' yas pa'i mos pa'i dbye ba las /
analyzed: de ji ltar gzugs sna tshogs pa'i nor bu bzhin du gdul bya mos pa tha dad pa du ma'i mngon par 'dod pa rnam pa du ma cig car rab tu gsal ba de yang 'dod par 'gyur ro // de nyid kyi phyir gdul bya mtha' yas pa'i mos pa'i dbye ba las /
translated: If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa gzhal du med pa dang ldan pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul ba'i sku dag ni bsgom par mi nus pa'i phyir de'i rgyu kho na la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa gzhal du med pa dang ldan pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul ba'i sku dag ni bsgom par mi nus pa'i phyir de'i rgyu kho na la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that just as it is, so too is the form body.

original: de yang bsgom pa tsam nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang bsgom pa tsam nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: If you accept that

original: de ltar re zhig rig pa las spros pa'i @42a * //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rig pa las spros pa'i @42a * //
translated: Thus, for the time being, the elaborations from awareness are🔽exhausted.

original: rnam pa bsgoms pas sangs rgyas nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bsgoms pas sangs rgyas nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, in the first place, buddhahood is not by the meditation on the forms emanated from the knowledge.

original: lung las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: lung las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by the scriptures,

original: de ltar yang dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gror /
analyzed: de ltar yang dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gror /
translated: as the Shri Vajraḍāka says:

original: ji ltar rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs pas //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs pas //
translated: By following the tantra,

original: byas pa'i mngon rtogs la mi rnams //
analyzed: byas pa'i mngon rtogs la mi rnams //
translated: people create the manifest realization.

original: 'bad pas nyon mongs bslang byas te //
analyzed: 'bad pas nyon mongs bslang byas te //
translated: Through the effort, the afflictions are aroused,

original: rang gi sems ni rnam par 'joms //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni rnam par 'joms //
translated: and their own minds are destroyed.

original: de phyir 'bad pa thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de phyir 'bad pa thams cad kyis //
translated: Therefore, by all efforts,

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs cho ga yi //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs cho ga yi //
translated: the rites of the maṇḍala, and so on,

original: bya bas rnam thar mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: bya bas rnam thar mi 'gyur te //
translated: are not the means of liberation,

original: 'khrul pa kho na'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa kho na'i rgyu yin no //
translated: but are only the cause of delusion.

original: zhes pa'o // dpal brtag pa gnyis kyi rgyal por yang /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // dpal brtag pa gnyis kyi rgyal por yang /
translated: And in the Shri Two Segments Tantra:

original: sngags kyi bzlas med dka' thub med cing sbyin sreg med /
analyzed: sngags kyi bzlas med dka' thub med cing sbyin sreg med /
translated: No mantra recitation, no austerities, no fire sacrifice,

original: dkyil 'khor pa med dkyil 'khor yang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa med dkyil 'khor yang ni yod ma yin //
translated: no maṇḍala, and no maṇḍala at all.

original: de ni sngags bzlas dka' thub de ste sbyin sreg de //
analyzed: de ni sngags bzlas dka' thub de ste sbyin sreg de //
translated: That is the mantra recitation, that is the austerity, that is the fire sacrifice,

original: de ni dkyil 'khor pa de de ni dkyil 'khor yang //
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor pa de de ni dkyil 'khor yang //
translated: that is the maṇḍala, and that is the maṇḍala.

original: bsdus pa las ni 'dus pa sems kyi gzugs can no //
analyzed: bsdus pa las ni 'dus pa sems kyi gzugs can no //
translated: The assembly is the mind with form.

original: zhes pa'o // dpal thig le kha sbyor las kyang /🔽stong bar bsgom par bya min te //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // dpal thig le kha sbyor las kyang / stong bar bsgom par bya min te //
translated: And in the Shri-Guhyasamaja:🔽Do not meditate on emptiness,

original: stong min yang ni bsgom pa min //
analyzed: stong min yang ni bsgom pa min //
translated: Nor meditate on non-emptiness.

original: stong min stong par 'dzin pa las //
analyzed: stong min stong par 'dzin pa las //
translated: Other than non-emptiness and emptiness,

original: gzhan du rtog pa skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du rtog pa skye bar 'gyur //
translated: There is no other meditation.

original: zhes pa'o // aindra bh'u ti'i zhabs kyis kyang //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // aindra bh'u ti'i zhabs kyis kyang //
translated: And Indrabhuti says:

original: phyag rgya dkyil 'khor sngags la sogs //
analyzed: phyag rgya dkyil 'khor sngags la sogs //
translated: Mudra, mandala, mantra, and so forth,

original: bzlas dang bsgom pa'i rtsol ba ste //
analyzed: bzlas dang bsgom pa'i rtsol ba ste //
translated: The effort of repetition and meditation,

original: bskal ba bye bar grangs med kyis //
analyzed: bskal ba bye bar grangs med kyis //
translated: Even for countless eons,

original: mchog gi grub pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mchog gi grub pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: Will not bring about the highest attainment.

original: zhes pa'o // sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang //
translated: And Saraha says:

original: sngags med rgyu med shes bya 'dzin pa med //
analyzed: sngags med rgyu med shes bya 'dzin pa med //
translated: Without mantra, without cause, without an object to grasp,

original: kye ho thams cad rmongs dang 'khrul pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: kye ho thams cad rmongs dang 'khrul pa'i rgyu //
translated: Alas! Everything is a cause of delusion and confusion.

original: dri med sems la sgom pas gos mi bya //
analyzed: dri med sems la sgom pas gos mi bya //
translated: The stainless mind is not sullied by meditation.

original: bde bar gnas pa'i sems la sdug mi bya //
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa'i sems la sdug mi bya //
translated: The mind of bliss is not made miserable.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so forth.

original: gal te de ltar na lha'i rnam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa ji ltar nye bar bstan zhe na 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi don du ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na lha'i rnam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa ji ltar nye bar bstan zhe na 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi don du ste /
translated: If that is so, how is the form of the deity and meditation, etc. taught? It is for the sake of mundane powers.

original: de 'dod pa rnams kho na'i don du'o zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: de 'dod pa rnams kho na'i don du'o zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that it is only for the sake of those who desire that.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is said:

original: dang po'i las can sems can gyi //
analyzed: dang po'i las can sems can gyi //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings who are beginners,

original: lha yi sku ni bsgoms pa yis //
analyzed: lha yi sku ni bsgoms pa yis //
translated: the form of the deity is taught

original: las kun rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: las kun rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to accomplish all activities.

original: dang por rgyud du nges par bstan //
analyzed: dang por rgyud du nges par bstan //
translated: It is taught in the tantras at the beginning.

original: zhes pa'o // de kho na'i ye shes kyi skal pa dang ldan par bya ba'i don tsam nyid do zhes gzhan no //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de kho na'i ye shes kyi skal pa dang ldan par bya ba'i don tsam nyid do zhes gzhan no //
translated: Others say that it is only for the sake of making them fit vessels for the wisdom of reality.🔽By meditating on the form of Śrī Heruka, etc. , only that much will be accomplished.

original: dpal he ru ka la sogs pa'i gzugs bsgoms pas de tsam kho na 'grub @42b bar 'gyur te de ltar yang /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka la sogs pa'i gzugs bsgoms pas de tsam kho na 'grub @42b bar 'gyur te de ltar yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: mtha' yas byang chub bde par gshegs pas bstan //
analyzed: mtha' yas byang chub bde par gshegs pas bstan //
translated: The Sugata taught infinite enlightenment.

original: zhes pa ste gzhan no //
analyzed: zhes pa ste gzhan no //
translated: Others say that.

original: 'di la sogs pa de rnams thams cad yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa de rnams thams cad yod pa ma yin te /
translated: All of that is not so.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyis bcom ldan 'das ni bsgrub par bya ba dang bsgom par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyis bcom ldan 'das ni bsgrub par bya ba dang bsgom par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One is to be accomplished and cultivated because he is of the nature of great bliss, which is of one taste with emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations.

original: rnam pa tsam ni nges par bsgom par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa tsam ni nges par bsgom par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The mere manifestation is definitely not to be cultivated.

original: chos nyid tsam yang rnam pa'i 'khor los logs su 'gram du gnas pa mi srid do //
analyzed: chos nyid tsam yang rnam pa'i 'khor los logs su 'gram du gnas pa mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible for the mere nature of things to stand apart from the retinue of manifestations.

original: gang 'ba' zhig ba bsgom par bya bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang 'ba' zhig ba bsgom par bya bar 'gyur ba /
translated: What is to be cultivated is

original: 'ba' zhig pa de sgom pa de ni de kho na'i don sgom pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa de sgom pa de ni de kho na'i don sgom pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: the cultivation of that alone. That cultivation is not the cultivation of reality itself.

original: de gsungs pa 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis /

analyzed: bde ba dmigs pa nyid mi 'gyur //

original: zhes pa dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: zhes pa dang de bzhin du //

original: dngos po'i gzugs kyang de nyid min //
analyzed: dngos po'i gzugs kyang de nyid min //

analyzed: phyag zhal rnam pa gzugs can dang // gzugs med pa la mchog gi bde // zhes pa'o // 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis kyang //

original: don 'di kho na la dgongs te gsungs pa /
analyzed: don 'di kho na la dgongs te gsungs pa /
translated: Noble Haribhadra also taught this very point:

analyzed: mdo rgyud rtog bsres su /
translated: In the sutra and tantra, mixed with reasoning,

analyzed: bdag lta bu'i so so skye bos thog ma med pa'i phyi rol gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa sna tshogs pa'i mngon par zhen pas /
translated: Ordinary beings like me, due to beginningless adherence to various external entities and non-entities,

original: med pa nyid dang yod pa nyid gcig nyid dang du ma nyid dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa dang yod pa ma yin pa dang med pa ma yin pa dang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i bag chags kyi rang bzhin gyi rgyu mngon par rtogs
analyzed: med pa nyid dang yod pa nyid gcig nyid dang du ma nyid dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa dang yod pa ma yin pa dang med pa ma yin pa dang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i bag chags kyi rang bzhin gyi rgyu mngon par rtogs
translated: Have the nature of habitual tendencies of non-existence and existence, one and many, both and neither, not existent and not non-existent, permanent and impermanent.

original: pa'i rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la slob par 'dod pas ji ltar rim pas bslab par bgyi'am /
analyzed: pa'i rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la slob par 'dod pas ji ltar rim pas bslab par bgyi'am /
translated: One who wishes to train in the meditative concentration of the perfection stage, which is free from the conceptualization of the I and the mine, should ask, How should I train in stages?

original: 'on te bla ma'i gdams ngag tsam gyis skad cig gis gsal bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'on te bla ma'i gdams ngag tsam gyis skad cig gis gsal bar bgyi /
translated: Or, should I clarify it in an instant just by the guru's instruction?

original: rdo rje slob dpon gyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon gyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The vajra master replies,

original: rim gyis zhugs te bslab par bya'i cig car ni ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rim gyis zhugs te bslab par bya'i cig car ni ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: You should train in stages, not all at once.

original: de dag gis ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa phal cher dang mi ldan pa kho na ste 'phags pa'i sa thob pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa goms par byed par rigs so zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa phal cher dang mi ldan pa kho na ste 'phags pa'i sa thob pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa goms par byed par rigs so zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: By these [statements], one should understand that only one who is free from most conceptualizations of entities and non-entities, and so on, is fit to cultivate the perfection stage after attaining the noble grounds.

original: lhag par mos pa tsam ni cig shos kyi yang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa tsam ni cig shos kyi yang 'gal ba med do //
translated: But mere resolute faith is not contradictory for the other [type of person].

original: gang yang goms pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'di las lam khong du chud pa med pa'i phyir dang / brjod pa med pa'i phyir dang / glo bur ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: gang yang goms pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'di las lam khong du chud pa med pa'i phyir dang / brjod pa med pa'i phyir dang / glo bur ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because it is not familiar to anyone, because the path is not comprehended from this, because it is inexpressible, because it is adventitious, because it is free from afflictions, because it is not always hidden,🔽and because it is the object of the guru’s speech.

original: bla ma'i bka'i dga' ba las dbang po'i tshogs mtha' dag bkag pa las rang rig pa tsam gang ci yin pa de ni byin gyis @45a * //
analyzed: bla ma'i bka'i dga' ba las dbang po'i tshogs mtha' dag bkag pa las rang rig pa tsam gang ci yin pa de ni byin gyis @45a * //
translated: Whatever is mere self-awareness, which is the negation of all the collections of sense faculties, is the blessing of the guru.

original: brlab pa'i zhes pa 'di la sogs pa bla ma'i mthu'i dbang du byas te tha ga pa la sogs pas gsungs pa de yang rnam pa de lta bu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs nye bar bsags pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag la ltos nas rtogs par
analyzed: brlab pa'i zhes pa 'di la sogs pa bla ma'i mthu'i dbang du byas te tha ga pa la sogs pas gsungs pa de yang rnam pa de lta bu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs nye bar bsags pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag la ltos nas rtogs par
translated: This and so on is stated by the guru’s power. That is also to be understood in dependence on a person who possesses the accumulation of merit and wisdom that is well gathered,

original: bya ste / gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa gcig kha nas sems can thams cad sgrol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ste / gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa gcig kha nas sems can thams cad sgrol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise, all sentient beings would be liberated from the mouth of a single tathāgata.

original: de'i phyir brtag pa gnyis pa la sogs par gsungs pa kho na goms pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brtag pa gnyis pa la sogs par gsungs pa kho na goms pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the sequence of cultivation is just what is stated in the second examination, etc.

original: de la gsungs pa ni /🔽bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: de la gsungs pa ni / bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: What is stated there is:🔽The yogi/nī of the creation stage

original: spres pa bsgom bya brtul zhugs can ;
analyzed: spres pa bsgom bya brtul zhugs can ;
translated: should meditate on emanation, being disciplined.

original: / spros pa rmi lam ltar byas nas //
analyzed: / spros pa rmi lam ltar byas nas //
translated: Having made emanation like a dream,

original: spros pa rnams kyis spros med byas //
analyzed: spros pa rnams kyis spros med byas //
translated: the unemanated is made by emanations.

original: de ltar sgyu ma ji ltar rmi //
analyzed: de ltar sgyu ma ji ltar rmi //
translated: Thus, how is illusion like a dream?

original: ji ltar bar do'i srid pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar bar do'i srid pa yin //
translated: How is it like the intermediate state?

original: de bzhin nyid du dkyil 'khor gsal //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du dkyil 'khor gsal //
translated: In the same way, the maṇḍala is clear.

original: rtag tu goms pa'i sbyor ba las //
analyzed: rtag tu goms pa'i sbyor ba las //
translated: From the yoga of constant cultivation,

original: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du 'dus pa phyi mar /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du 'dus pa phyi mar /
translated: In the same way, in the Later Guhyasamāja,

original: thabs kyi rgyud du grags pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pas ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir gzhi'i rang bzhin du gsungs so //
analyzed: thabs kyi rgyud du grags pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pas ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir gzhi'i rang bzhin du gsungs so //
translated: the creation stage that is renowned in the method tantras is said to be the nature of the basis because it is the cause of the generation, abiding, and increase of the completion stage.

original: don 'di nyid dom bi pa'i zhabs kyis kyang bstan te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid dom bi pa'i zhabs kyis kyang bstan te /
translated: This very point is also taught by the venerable Aśvaghoṣa:

original: bsgom pa rnams kyi thog ma'i bya ba bskyed pa'i rim pa legs blo'i dbang phyug rnams //
analyzed: bsgom pa rnams kyi thog ma'i bya ba bskyed pa'i rim pa legs blo'i dbang phyug rnams //
translated: The first task of the meditators is the creation stage, which is the domain of the great masters.

original: phyag rgya sngags dang rnam dag brjod pa thams cad 'dir ni nges par brjod mi bya //
analyzed: phyag rgya sngags dang rnam dag brjod pa thams cad 'dir ni nges par brjod mi bya //
translated: Here, the seals, mantras, and all the pure recitations are not to be expressed.

original: phul byung blo gros thob ste slar yang de nyid sems gcig legs par blo //
analyzed: phul byung blo gros thob ste slar yang de nyid sems gcig legs par blo //
translated: Having attained the highest intellect, one should again properly focus the mind on that.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa'i bsam gtan las ni rtag tu dga' ba srid pa 'joms //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa'i bsam gtan las ni rtag tu dga' ba srid pa 'joms //
translated: From the meditation of the completion stage, there is always the joy that conquers existence.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i gnas skabs su bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa po rnam pa'i 'khor lo bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis rgyun ma 'chad par gnas so zhes pa yang ji ltar sgyu ma zhes pa la sogs pa
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i gnas skabs su bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa po rnam pa'i 'khor lo bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis rgyun ma 'chad par gnas so zhes pa yang ji ltar sgyu ma zhes pa la sogs pa
translated: In the context of the completion stage, the meditator on the creation stage continuously abides by the single taste of the great bliss nature of the wheel of the aspects and emptiness. This is also stated in the following lines from the glorious Hevajra Tantra:🔽“Like an illusion, like a dream, like a city of gandharvas, like a mirage, like a reflection, like an echo, like a visual aberration, like a phantom creation.”

original: dpal kye'i rdo rje'i tshigs su bcad pa las gsal bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dpal kye'i rdo rje'i tshigs su bcad pa las gsal bar rtogs par bya'o //

original: mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du yang /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du yang /
translated: In the Vajra Tent of the dakinis, it is also stated:

original: kye'i / grogs po chu nang zla ba ltar //
analyzed: kye'i / grogs po chu nang zla ba ltar //
translated: “O friend, like the moon in water,

original: brdzun pa dang ni brdzun ma yin //
analyzed: brdzun pa dang ni brdzun ma yin //

original: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo de ltar te //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo de ltar te //

original: lus ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa //
analyzed: lus ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa //
translated: The body is pure by nature.

original: zhes pa'o // gang yang /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gang yang /
translated: And also:

analyzed: gang las de bzhin gshegs @45b chags pa // lha dang lha mo'i 'khor lo las //
translated: From which the Tathāgata is born,🔽from the wheel of the circle of gods and goddesses,

original: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo rnam bral ba //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo rnam bral ba //
translated: free from the maṇḍala wheel,

original: lhan skyes skad cig la gnas so //
analyzed: lhan skyes skad cig la gnas so //
translated: the innate abides in an instant.

original: zhes pa / nag po zhabs kyis gsungs pa de ni rang dbang du gyur pas slar yid la byed la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa / nag po zhabs kyis gsungs pa de ni rang dbang du gyur pas slar yid la byed la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is said by Kṛṣṇācārya. Since one becomes independent, one is free from mental activity.

original: yang gal te gzhan du na pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul las 'di gang gis khyad par du 'phags te spros pa dang bral ba bsgom pas rdzogs pa'i rim par brjod pa'i phyir dang / gnyis ka la mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang gal te gzhan du na pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul las 'di gang gis khyad par du 'phags te spros pa dang bral ba bsgom pas rdzogs pa'i rim par brjod pa'i phyir dang / gnyis ka la mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Again, if it is different, by what is this superior to the Pāramitā system, since it is said to be the stage of completion by meditating on freedom from conceptual elaborations, and because of the equality of both?

original: gsungs pa ni sgo mtha' yas pa'i gzungs las /🔽bsam bya bsam du med bsam ste //
analyzed: gsungs pa ni sgo mtha' yas pa'i gzungs las / bsam bya bsam du med bsam ste //
translated: It is said in the Dhāraṇī of Infinite Doors:🔽The inconceivable should be contemplated as inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab nyid mi bsam //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab nyid mi bsam //
translated: The inconceivable itself should not be contemplated.

original: bsam bya rnam par mi sems pa //
analyzed: bsam bya rnam par mi sems pa //
translated: The dhāraṇīs are attained

original: de las gzungs rnams thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: de las gzungs rnams thob par 'gyur //
translated: from the non-contemplation of the object of thought.🔽Here, in the thirty-third chapter,

original: zhes pa'o // 'dir yang le'u sum cu rtsa gsum par //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'dir yang le'u sum cu rtsa gsum par //
translated: it is said:

original: gang gi tshe na de nyid rig / bsam pa thams cad bsam du med //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na de nyid rig / bsam pa thams cad bsam du med //
translated: When one knows reality, all thoughts are inconceivable.

original: gang du bsam du med sems pa //
analyzed: gang du bsam du med sems pa //
translated: Where there is the thought of the inconceivable,

original: de tshe bsam mi khyab par 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe bsam mi khyab par 'gyur //
translated: then the inconceivable is attained.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: l'u yi pa'i zhabs kyi mngon par rtogs par yang /🔽bsam med bsam bya de yang ni //🔽sems la'ang mtshon du med pa nyid //
analyzed: l'u yi pa'i zhabs kyi mngon par rtogs par yang / bsam med bsam bya de yang ni // sems la'ang mtshon du med pa nyid //
translated: In the realization of Luipa's disciple it is said:🔽The inconceivable object of thought🔽is also inexpressible in the mind.

original: de yang bsam mi khyab sems dpa' //
analyzed: de yang bsam mi khyab sems dpa' //
translated: That is the inconceivable thought

original: de las gzungs rnams thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: de las gzungs rnams thob par 'gyur //
translated: from which the dhāraṇīs are attained.

original: zhes pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang /
translated: And in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: gang nam mkha' la rnal 'byor du byed pa de dang / bla gab med pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang nam mkha' la rnal 'byor du byed pa de dang / bla gab med pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: He who practices yoga in space and he who practices yoga in the open air practices yoga in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin nyid kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin nyid kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The nature of great bliss should be understood in the perfection vehicle.

original: ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs las gsungs pa /
translated: As the Dhāraṇī of Entering Nonconceptuality says:🔽Peaceful, unwavering, supreme,

original: rab tu zhi ba mi g-yo mchog / dbang chen mnyam dang mi mnyam pa //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba mi g-yo mchog / dbang chen mnyam dang mi mnyam pa //
translated: great power, equal, unequal,

original: de phyir rnam par rtog med bde //
analyzed: de phyir rnam par rtog med bde //
translated: therefore nonconceptual bliss.

original: byang chub sems dpa' brtags par 'gyur ;🔽/ zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brtags par 'gyur ; / zhes pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is designated.

original: de bzhin du yab sras mjal bar yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yab sras mjal bar yang /
translated: Similarly, the Meeting of Father and Son Sūtra says:

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad bde bas khyab pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad bde bas khyab pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de /
translated: “Bhagavan, there is the meditative absorption called ‘pervading all phenomena with bliss.’

original: ting nge 'dzin gang thob nas byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa'i dngos po thams cad la tshor ba bde ba kho na myong bar @46a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang thob nas byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa'i dngos po thams cad la tshor ba bde ba kho na myong bar @46a * //
translated: Having attained that meditative absorption, a bodhisattva experiences only the bliss of feeling in all things that are objects of observation.

original: 'gyur gyi / sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin bde ba ma yin pa'ang ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs nas k'arsh'a pa na'i tshad tsam du bcad cing gtubs te gong bur bcos pa rnams kyang 'tshed pa dang glang po rnams kyis🔽brdzis pa la yang bde ba'i 'du shes kho na rab tu 'jug go zhes pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gyur gyi / sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin bde ba ma yin pa'ang ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs nas k'arsh'a pa na'i tshad tsam du bcad cing gtubs te gong bur bcos pa rnams kyang 'tshed pa dang glang po rnams kyis brdzis pa la yang bde ba'i 'du shes kho na rab tu 'jug go zhes pa gsungs so //
translated: But it is not so.  It is neither painful nor not painful. Having said this, he cut off and chopped up the body into pieces the size of a karṣa-pana, and even when it was being cooked and trampled by the elephants, he said, Only the notion of pleasure is operating.

original: bde ba de dag kyang sngags kyi theg pa dang mi mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba de dag kyang sngags kyi theg pa dang mi mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: And those pleasures are not incompatible with the Vehicle of the Mantra.

original: mi bde ba yang mchog tu bde //
analyzed: mi bde ba yang mchog tu bde //
translated: And Even pain is supremely blissful,

original: zhes pa / gal te grub na bsgrub bya gzhan med do //
analyzed: zhes pa / gal te grub na bsgrub bya gzhan med do //
translated: if it is accomplished, there is no other object of attainment.

original: zhes pa sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis so //
translated: Thus it is said by the venerable Saraha.

original: 'di'i thabs la gsungs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i thabs la gsungs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not said that this is the method for that.

original: byang chub kyi sems kho na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa mtha' dag gi rgyu'i gtso bo zhes pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la thams cad du
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kho na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa mtha' dag gi rgyu'i gtso bo zhes pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la thams cad du
translated: Because only the thought of awakening is the nature of the entire collection of merit and wisdom, it is taught everywhere in the Perfection Vehicle that it is the principal cause of all the perfect happiness of the world and beyond the world.

translated: because it is said, “Some, having abandoned objects,

analyzed: thabs gzhan ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i chos sa la sogs pa rnams ni tshul gnyis kar yang khyad par med pa kho na ste /

analyzed: gang yang rdo rje snying po rgyan du kun du bzang po'i 'od ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pa yang rab tu dka' ba la sogs pa las ming gzhan pa'o //
translated: Also, in the Vajra Essence Ornament, it is said, “the light of Samantabhadra,” and so on.

analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis kyang sngags kyi tshul phal cher du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa med na sngags kyi tshul las khyad par med pa kho na'o //

analyzed: gang yang bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin khon thog ma nas brtsams te sngags kyi tshul las so sor rtogs par bya zhing goms par bya'o //

original: de yang thabs gzhan gyis mi nus pa'i phyir /

original: thabs dang bcas pa la goms par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs dang bcas pa la goms par bya'o //

analyzed: de yang thabs kyi rgyud du brjod pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa de kho na'o //

original: de ltar na de yang lag bdun dang ldan par goms par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de yang lag bdun dang ldan par goms par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should cultivate it with the seven limbs.

original: de la dpal bde mchog gi rnam pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de la dpal bde mchog gi rnam pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i yan lag go //

original: rdo rje phag mo la kun du 'khyud pa ni kha sbyor gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo la kun du 'khyud pa ni kha sbyor gyi yan lag go //

original: de'i dga' ba ni bde ba chen po'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de'i dga' ba ni bde ba chen po'i yan lag go //

analyzed: de stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa ni rang bzhin med pa'i yan lag go //

original: de las ldang ba ni snying rje'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de las ldang ba ni snying rje'i yan lag go //

original: de bar ma chad pas rgyun chad mad par bsgom pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de bar ma chad pas rgyun chad mad par bsgom pa'i yan lag go //

analyzed: po gsum ni thun mong ma yin pa ste theg pa gzhan las ma gsungs so zhes pas so //

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dus pa phyi mar thabs kyi rgyud du brjod pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa ni gzhi nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dus pa phyi mar thabs kyi rgyud du brjod pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa ni gzhi nyid du gsungs te /

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgoms pas gnas pa kho na 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin zhing 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyang de kho na rtogs pa'i snod tsam dang / de tsam mngon du byed pa yang ma yin no zhes pa ste ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas chog go //

translated: Therefore, the cultivation of the creation stage is not just a branch for the attainment of mundane powers, and it is not just a vessel for the realization of reality, and it is not just the manifestation of that, because it is too much.

original: de ltar bsgom pa dang bzlas pa mchog gi rnal 'byor pa 'di'i spyod pa mdor bstan pa sems kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'di dag kyang phyi nas rgyas par bstan par bya'o //

translated: Thus, the conduct of this supreme yoga practitioner who meditates and recites is briefly indicated by the words “mind” and so forth, and these will be taught extensively later.

original: // / gzhon num rnams mnyes pa ci //
analyzed: // / gzhon num rnams mnyes pa ci //

analyzed: zhes zhu ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i lan gdab pa'i don du gsungs pa /

analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: mchod pa zhes pa mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub dag gsol ba gdab pa ste /

analyzed: dpa' bo zhes pa rnal 'byor ma'o //

analyzed: de dag nyid rgyas par ston pa rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

original: 'dir rim pa 'di yin te ;
analyzed: 'dir rim pa 'di yin te ;

original: dam tshig gi ril bus bsangs la /
analyzed: dam tshig gi ril bus bsangs la /

translated: Having accomplished it well with the rite of accomplishing nectar, beginning with a young woman who is not incomplete in her limbs,🔽to the extent that one is able, one should summon the goddess in the form of a young woman in the morning. In the early morning, one should invite her, having washed and anointed her,

analyzed: dben pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig tu byug pa dang bsang ba dang rab tu bdug pa bya ste /

translated: Having requested her to sit on a comfortable seat in a circle or a row, one should visualize her in the form of the pledge being, arisen from emptiness, in an instant, inside the celestial mansion situated on Meru.

original: ye shes sems dpa' rab tu bcug ste /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' rab tu bcug ste /

translated: Having made offerings of water for drinking, water for the feet, water for the mouth, and sprinkling water, as well as eye ointment, sindūra, fragrant powders, unguents, fragrant flower garlands, incense, and so forth,🔽and if one can afford it, clothing, ornaments, and so forth,

analyzed: gtor ma sbyin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i pad kor dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa nye bar bstan nas /

analyzed: 'dod pa ji lta bar tshim par bya zhing bstod pa dang glu rnams kyis kyang ngo //
translated: one should satisfy the deities according to one’s desire and with praises and songs.

original: mchod pa'i khyad par 'di'i 'bras bu ston pa 'dir ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'di rnams la mchod pa bya ste'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'i khyad par 'di'i 'bras bu ston pa 'dir ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'di rnams la mchod pa bya ste'o //
translated: The result of this special offering is taught here in the lines beginning “Here, one should make offerings to these deities.”

original: mtshan mor zhes pa gnyis pa'i don la bdun pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mor zhes pa gnyis pa'i don la bdun pa'o //
translated: The two words “at night” have the sense of the seventh case.

original: mchod de zhes pa mchod pa ni @48a * //
analyzed: mchod de zhes pa mchod pa ni @48a * //

translated: to the faithful, having made her pleasing to them, she is not in the sphere of the unworthy.

original: gsungs pa'i rim pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa blangs nas padma'i snod du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i rim pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa blangs nas padma'i snod du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having taken Vairochana, and so on, in the sequence stated, one should place it in a lotus vessel.

original: de bzhin du go ku la sogs pa lnga gang gis kyang ma bsad pa ji ltar gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du go ku la sogs pa lnga gang gis kyang ma bsad pa ji ltar gsungs pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the five ambrosias, and so on, are not killed by any of the five, as stated.

original: med na ji ltar rnyed pa yang blangs nas rdzas bcu po rnams gla rtsi la sogs pa dri bzang po rnams kyis bsres te /
analyzed: med na ji ltar rnyed pa yang blangs nas rdzas bcu po rnams gla rtsi la sogs pa dri bzang po rnams kyis bsres te /
translated: If not, then having taken it as found, one should mix the ten substances with good scents such as musk.

original: bcu pa la sran ma'i chad kyi ril bu byas nas shin tu sbas te grib ma la skam par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu pa la sran ma'i chad kyi ril bu byas nas shin tu sbas te grib ma la skam par bya'o //
translated: Having made them into pills the size of a bean, one should very well conceal them and dry them in the shade.

original: de nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i dbus su padma'i snod du bzhag la gyen du 'greng ba'i lag pa g-yas par nyi ma'i gzugs bkod cing lag pa g-yon par zla ba'i gzugs kyis bkab ste /
analyzed: de nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i dbus su padma'i snod du bzhag la gyen du 'greng ba'i lag pa g-yas par nyi ma'i gzugs bkod cing lag pa g-yon par zla ba'i gzugs kyis bkab ste /
translated: Then, having placed them in a lotus vessel in the middle of the ganacakra, one should visualize the form of the sun on the right hand standing upright, and the form of the moon on the left hand.

original: lha'i rnal 'byor sngon du song bas bdud rtsi sgrub pa'i chogs rnam par bsgom zhing /
analyzed: lha'i rnal 'byor sngon du song bas bdud rtsi sgrub pa'i chogs rnam par bsgom zhing /
translated: Having gone before in the yoga of the deity, one should visualize the ritual of accomplishing the nectar.

original: aom ha ho: hr'i: zhes pa 'di yis te /
analyzed: aom ha ho: hr'i: zhes pa 'di yis te /
translated: With this, “Oṃ ha ho hrīḥ,”

original: yang na / aom a'a: h'um zhes pa 'di yis brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na / aom a'a: h'um zhes pa 'di yis brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: or with this, “Oṃ āḥ hūṃ,” one should consecrate them by repeating [the mantra] one hundred and eight times.

original: de nas las thams cad la nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas las thams cad la nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should definitely apply them to all activities.

original: le'u bcu drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bcu drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the sixteenth chapter on the procedure of the hero’s conduct.

original: // / nyid kyis dkyil 'khor bri bar gsungs //
analyzed: // / nyid kyis dkyil 'khor bri bar gsungs //
translated: The mandala is drawn by oneself.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa zhu ba nyi shu rtsa dgu pa la sogs pa bzhi'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa zhu ba nyi shu rtsa dgu pa la sogs pa bzhi'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, in order to answer the twenty-nine questions beginning with this one, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then, Vajrapāṇi, the Lord of the Secret Ones,” and so forth.

original: de la 'di ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bcas pas sngon du bsnyen pa'i mtshan nyid dang srung ba'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bcas pas sngon du bsnyen pa'i mtshan nyid dang srung ba'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: In this regard, the first half of the verse beginning with “thus” [refers to] the characteristics of the preliminary service and the protection wheel.

original: bstan zhing zhes pa la sogs pa ni skabs yin pa'i phyir slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bstan zhing zhes pa la sogs pa ni skabs yin pa'i phyir slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: “Having taught” and so forth [refers to] the characteristics of the master, because it is the context.

original: gtsug lag khang zhes pa la sogs pa mchog gi sngom pa 'byung ba zhes pa'i bar ni sa sbyang ba ste /🔽yongs su bzung ba la sogs pa @50a * //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang zhes pa la sogs pa mchog gi sngom pa 'byung ba zhes pa'i bar ni sa sbyang ba ste / yongs su bzung ba la sogs pa @50a * //
translated: “The temple” and so forth up to “the arising of the supreme vow” [refers to] the purification of the ground.

original: yang sbyang ba'i sgra'i rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: yang sbyang ba'i sgra'i rnam par bshad do //
translated: “Possession” and so forth are explained by the word “purification.”

original: lnga zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i cho ga yis zhes pa'i bar ni thig gdab pa'o //
analyzed: lnga zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i cho ga yis zhes pa'i bar ni thig gdab pa'o //
translated: “Five” and so forth up to “by the rite that is taught” [refers to] the layout of the maṇḍala.

original: rin chen lnga zhes pa la sogs pa lhag ma rdul tshon gdab pa ste /
analyzed: rin chen lnga zhes pa la sogs pa lhag ma rdul tshon gdab pa ste /
translated: The “five jewels” and so forth are the remaining colored powders.

original: 'dir ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sgra nyid kyis rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sgra nyid kyis rnam par bshad do //
translated: Here, the very word “drawing” of the maṇḍala is explained.

original: 'di ltar zhes pa 'di dag thams cad 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa 'di dag thams cad 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Thus” is all of that which is to be explained.

original: kha cig ces pa cung zad do //
analyzed: kha cig ces pa cung zad do //
translated: “Some” is a little.

original: sa zhes pa sa rnams te rang sems sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam pa nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: sa zhes pa sa rnams te rang sems sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam pa nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: “Earth” is the maṇḍalas, which are completely pure by means of one’s own mind, which is like an illusion.

original: gsol gdab zhes pa sgo'i slob dpon rnams kyis so//
analyzed: gsol gdab zhes pa sgo'i slob dpon rnams kyis so//
translated: “Request” is by the door masters.

original: mkha' 'gro ma lhan cig zhes pa shes rab dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma lhan cig zhes pa shes rab dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “Together with the ḍākinīs” is together with the wisdom [consort].

original: dang po bzhi 'gyur tshad kyis ni //
analyzed: dang po bzhi 'gyur tshad kyis ni //
translated: The first is four finger breadths.

original: zhes pa 'gyur ba dang bgrang ba dang rnam par dbye ba'o //🔽'di yis ni zhes pa 'gyur ni cha chung ste sgo'i bzhi cha'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'gyur ba dang bgrang ba dang rnam par dbye ba'o // 'di yis ni zhes pa 'gyur ni cha chung ste sgo'i bzhi cha'o //
translated: “Changing” is changing, counting, and distinguishing.🔽“By this” is changing, which is one-fourth of a finger breadth.

original: de'i phyir tshangs thig gi logs gcig tu padma'i ze'u 'bru rnam par bcad pa'i don du cha chung bzhi pa'i thig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshangs thig gi logs gcig tu padma'i ze'u 'bru rnam par bcad pa'i don du cha chung bzhi pa'i thig go //
translated: Therefore, the line of the Brahmā thread is four finger breadths in order to cut off the stamen of the lotus.

original: de'i phyi rol du brgyad 'gyur 'di yis ni //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du brgyad 'gyur 'di yis ni //
translated: Outside of that, by this eightfold

analyzed: zhes pa padma'i 'dab ma rnam par bcad pa'i don to //
translated: means the division of the lotus petals.

original: slar yang brgyad 'gyur 'di yis ni //
analyzed: slar yang brgyad 'gyur 'di yis ni //

analyzed: zhes pa tshangs pa'i logs gnyis kar cha chung brgyad las phyi rol du cha chung bzhi'i bar gyis rtsa ba'i thig go //

analyzed: 'di nas brtsams te thig thams cad logs gnyis kar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: From here on, all the lines should be understood on both sides.

original: de las nyis 'gyur nyid kyis kyang //
analyzed: de las nyis 'gyur nyid kyis kyang //

original: zhes pa cha chung gi bar gyis rtsig pa'i thig go //
analyzed: zhes pa cha chung gi bar gyis rtsig pa'i thig go //
translated: the wall line is by two fingerbreadths.

original: de las bzhi 'gyur 'di yis ni //
analyzed: de las bzhi 'gyur 'di yis ni //

original: zhes pa cha chung gnyis kyi bar du stegs bu'i thig go //
analyzed: zhes pa cha chung gnyis kyi bar du stegs bu'i thig go //
translated: the platform line is by two fingerbreadths.

original: slar yang nyis 'gyur 'di yis ni //
analyzed: slar yang nyis 'gyur 'di yis ni //
translated: Again, double that

analyzed: zhes pa cha chung gcig gi mthar rin chen snam bu'i thig go //
translated: means that the line of the jewel ledge is at the end of one fingerbreadth.

original: de las bzhi 'gyur 'di yis ni //
analyzed: de las bzhi 'gyur 'di yis ni //
translated: By quadruple that,

original: zhes pa cha chung gnyis kyi bar gyis dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa'i thig go //
analyzed: zhes pa cha chung gnyis kyi bar gyis dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa'i thig go //
translated: the line of the latticework and half-latticework is by two fingerbreadths.

original: de las nyis 'gyur 'di yis ni //
analyzed: de las nyis 'gyur 'di yis ni //
translated: From that, double this.

original: zhes pa cha chung re re'i bar gyis rin chen shar bu dang mda' yab kyi don du thig gnyis gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa cha chung re re'i bar gyis rin chen shar bu dang mda' yab kyi don du thig gnyis gdab par bya'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the two lines that are drawn for each intermediate unit.🔽If it is asked, “How are the eight units, and so on, that are taught

original: gal te de dag ji ltar cha chung brgyad la sogs par gsungs pa rnams la cha chung bzhi la sogs par 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te de dag ji ltar cha chung brgyad la sogs par gsungs pa rnams la cha chung bzhi la sogs par 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /

analyzed: de phyed zhes pa la sogs pa ste gsungs pa de'i @50b phyed phyogs gnyis la ni logs gnyis 'bri bar bya ste /
translated: it is said, “Half of that, and so on.” Half of that is drawn as two sides.

original: logs gnyis ka la yang /
analyzed: logs gnyis ka la yang /
translated: On both sides,🔽the two sides are drawn equally in the form of lines, and so on, and they

analyzed: thig la sogs pa'i rnam pa mnyam pa nyid kyis kha sbyor lta bur gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are arranged like a union.🔽These are said to be the celestial palaces with their retinues that end

analyzed: 'di rnams kyis mda' yab kyi mthar thug pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i gzhal yas khang gsungs so ;
translated: in the parapets.

original: /'di dag gis mdor bstan ba tsam ste /
analyzed: /'di dag gis mdor bstan ba tsam ste /
translated: This is merely a brief explanation.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa rgyud gzhan du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa rgyud gzhan du shes par bya'o //
translated: The complete explanation should be understood from other tantras.

original: de dag nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dag nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Those will now be explained.

original: thig skud ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thig skud ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The thread, etc.

original: thig skud kyi mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: thig skud kyi mtshan ma ni /
translated: The sign of the thread

original: 'dis mtshan ma zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis mtshan ma zhes pa'o //
translated: is by this, the sign.

original: thig skud mtshan ma ni cha chung ste /
analyzed: thig skud mtshan ma ni cha chung ste /
translated: The sign of the thread is a small unit,

original: de yang drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de yang drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: and that is sixty-four.

original: rnam dbye phyis pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
analyzed: rnam dbye phyis pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
translated: The mandala is by the division of the mandala, because of the division of the parts.🔽By how much is the mandala of sixty-four small units?

analyzed: ji tsam gyi bar gyis cha chung drug cu rtsa bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:
