analyzed: kun du 'khor lo'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'khor lo'i khor yug ni rdo rje'i phreng ba'o //
translated: The circumference of the wheel, etc. The circumference of the wheel is the vajra garland.

original: cho ga yis zhes pa sgo dang sgo khyud dang 'gram dang logs dang rta babs la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam par dbye ba'i rim pas so //
analyzed: cho ga yis zhes pa sgo dang sgo khyud dang 'gram dang logs dang rta babs la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam par dbye ba'i rim pas so //
translated: By the rite, by the sequence of the division of the doors, door-lintels, sides, walls, archways, etc.

original: ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: How? It is said: just so.

original: yang na tshangs pa dang zur dang rtsa ba'i thig rnams gnas pa la ji ltar bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang na tshangs pa dang zur dang rtsa ba'i thig rnams gnas pa la ji ltar bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Or, how is the location of the Brahmā, corner, and root threads? It is said:

original: dang por zhes pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dang por zhes pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: First, etc. , as before.

original: slar yang zhes pa rin chen snam bu'i bar ji srid pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang zhes pa rin chen snam bu'i bar ji srid pa'o //
translated: Again, etc. , up to the jewel ledge.

original: de las zhes pa dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa'i snam bu'i don du'o //
analyzed: de las zhes pa dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa'i snam bu'i don du'o //
translated: From that, etc. , for the purpose of the net and half-net ledges.

original: de las bzhi 'gyur zhes pa rin chen shar bu'i snam bu dang rta babs kyi phyed ji srid par ro //
analyzed: de las bzhi 'gyur zhes pa rin chen shar bu'i snam bu dang rta babs kyi phyed ji srid par ro //
translated: From that, etc. , for the purpose of the jewel-crest ledge and half of the arch.

original: cha chung drug cu rtsa bzhi pa'i phyogs la rta babs kyang steng du cha chung bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: cha chung drug cu rtsa bzhi pa'i phyogs la rta babs kyang steng du cha chung bzhi pa'o //
translated: On the side of the sixty-four-part [square], the arch is four parts high.

original: slar yang zhes pa rta babs rnam par bcad pa'i don du'o //🔽de las zhes pa cha chung gnyis pa'i 'khor lo dang ra'i don du'o //
analyzed: slar yang zhes pa rta babs rnam par bcad pa'i don du'o // de las zhes pa cha chung gnyis pa'i 'khor lo dang ra'i don du'o //
translated: Again, etc. , for the purpose of the archway.🔽From that, etc. , for the purpose of the two-part wheel and rain-spout.

original: de las zhes pa cha chung gnyis gnyis kyi bar gyis 'dab ma'i phreng ba dang ; rdo rje'i phreng ba dang 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i don du thig gnyis gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de las zhes pa cha chung gnyis gnyis kyi bar gyis 'dab ma'i phreng ba dang ; rdo rje'i phreng ba dang 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i don du thig gnyis gdab par bya'o //
translated: From that, etc. , for the purpose of the garland of petals, the garland of vajras, and the garland of light-rays, two lines should be drawn with the distance of two parts each.

original: de'i 'dab ma'i phreng ba dang rdo rje'i phreng ba yang so sor cha chung gnyis sam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'dab ma'i phreng ba dang rdo rje'i phreng ba yang so sor cha chung gnyis sam zhe na /
translated: The garland of petals and the garland of vajras are each two fingerbreadths apart.🔽The place of the second fingerbreadth beyond the line of the outer edge

original: de ra'i mtha'i thig las pha rol cha chung gnyis pa'i gnas te /🔽phyed phyogs gnyis la bri bya zhes pa phyed ji @51a * //
analyzed: de ra'i mtha'i thig las pha rol cha chung gnyis pa'i gnas te / phyed phyogs gnyis la bri bya zhes pa phyed ji @51a * //
translated: is the place of the second fingerbreadth beyond the line of the outer edge.

original: ltar gyur ba de bzhin du phyogs gnyis ka la bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ltar gyur ba de bzhin du phyogs gnyis ka la bri bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase should be drawn on the two sides means that just as it is on one side, so it should be drawn on the other side.

original: des na 'dab ma dang rdo rje phreng ba'i gnas ni cha chung re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'dab ma dang rdo rje phreng ba'i gnas ni cha chung re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the place of the garland of petals and the garland of vajras is one fingerbreadth each.

original: 'di yang bcom ldan 'das ni dur khrod brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba'i gzhal yas khang gi nang na bzhugs pa'i phyir dur khrod rnams kyang bri bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang bcom ldan 'das ni dur khrod brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba'i gzhal yas khang gi nang na bzhugs pa'i phyir dur khrod rnams kyang bri bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since the Bhagavān resides in the celestial mansion surrounded by the eight charnel grounds, it is said that the charnel grounds should also be drawn, and so on.

original: de la 'di ni phyi'i don te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni phyi'i don te /
translated: The outer meaning of this is as follows:

original: dkyil 'khor bri bar 'dod pa'i slob dpon bgegs dang bral ba'i don du bdud rtsi'i ril bus byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri bar 'dod pa'i slob dpon bgegs dang bral ba'i don du bdud rtsi'i ril bus byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: In order for the master who wishes to draw the maṇḍala to be free from obstacles, he should consecrate the nectar pill.

original: gtor ma sbyin pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: gtor ma sbyin pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: Having first given a sacrificial cake,

original: lha'i le'ur gsungs pa'i cho gas bdag nyid lha'i 'khor lo rab tu bsgoms la de'i sngags 'bum la sogs pa'i grangs bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i le'ur gsungs pa'i cho gas bdag nyid lha'i 'khor lo rab tu bsgoms la de'i sngags 'bum la sogs pa'i grangs bzlas par bya ste /
translated: one should meditate on the wheel of the deity according to the rite taught in the chapter on the deity and recite the mantra of that deity one hundred thousand times, etc.

original: ji srid 'khor lo dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo'i mgon po'i gzugs rnam pa thams cad rdzogs pa bdag nyid la cig char spro ba dang bsdu ba lhag par mos par nus pa dang / de'i gnang ba thob pa zhes pa sngon du bsnyen pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: ji srid 'khor lo dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo'i mgon po'i gzugs rnam pa thams cad rdzogs pa bdag nyid la cig char spro ba dang bsdu ba lhag par mos par nus pa dang / de'i gnang ba thob pa zhes pa sngon du bsnyen pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of prior service, which is to be performed until one is able to imagine the form of the Lord of the Wheel together with the wheel emanating and reabsorbing all at once, and until one obtains permission from him.

original: de nas yid du 'ong ba'i phyogs 'ga' zhig tu dkyil 'khor bri ba'i don du srod la dri bzangs la sogs pas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i mandala byas la yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: de nas yid du 'ong ba'i phyogs 'ga' zhig tu dkyil 'khor bri ba'i don du srod la dri bzangs la sogs pas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i mandala byas la yang dag par mchod de /
translated: Then, in order to draw the mandala in a certain delightful place, one should make a maṇḍala of one’s desired deity with fragrant substances, etc., in the evening, and worship it perfectly.

original: gtor ma byin nas de rnams nam mkhar bkod la de na 'khod pa'i zhing skyong la sogs pa la gtor ma rnams kyis tshim par byas nas /
analyzed: gtor ma byin nas de rnams nam mkhar bkod la de na 'khod pa'i zhing skyong la sogs pa la gtor ma rnams kyis tshim par byas nas /
translated: Having given a sacrificial cake, one should arrange them in the sky and, having satisfied the field protectors, etc., who are there, with the sacrificial cakes, one should dismiss them.

original: gang yang 'dir gnas lha dang klu //
analyzed: gang yang 'dir gnas lha dang klu //
translated: Whatever gods and nāgas dwell here,

original: gnod sbyin srin po'am gzhan la yang //🔽dkyil 'khor don dus 'di ni //
analyzed: gnod sbyin srin po'am gzhan la yang // dkyil 'khor don dus 'di ni //
translated: yakṣas, rākṣasas, or others,🔽please grant me this site

original: bdag zhu khyed kyis stsal du gsol //
analyzed: bdag zhu khyed kyis stsal du gsol //
translated: for the sake of the maṇḍala.”

original: zhes lan gsum brjod pas /
analyzed: zhes lan gsum brjod pas /
translated: Recite this three times.

original: de rnams kyis rmi lam la sogs par byin pa'am /
analyzed: de rnams kyis rmi lam la sogs par byin pa'am /
translated: If they grant it in a dream, or if they do not prevent it,

original: yang na ma bkag par shes nas nyi ma gzhan gyi snga dro bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa nam mkhar bzhugs pa la gsol ba btab ste /
analyzed: yang na ma bkag par shes nas nyi ma gzhan gyi snga dro bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa nam mkhar bzhugs pa la gsol ba btab ste /
translated: knowing that, on the following morning, the Bhagavat and entourage are invited to remain in the sky,

original: de'i rjes su gnang ba zhes yid kyis mos par byas nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes su gnang ba zhes yid kyis mos par byas nas /
translated: and after that, one should imagine that they consent.

original: nyi ma gung la srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgoms pas bgegs tshar bcad de /
analyzed: nyi ma gung la srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgoms pas bgegs tshar bcad de /
translated: At noon, one should meditate on the protection wheel, and having destroyed the obstructors,🔽one should sprinkle the ground with mustard seed, water, and ash, while reciting the mantra of all activities.

original: las thams cad pa'i sngags bzlas shing yungs kar dang chu dang thal ba rnams kyis sa la bsang gtor byas la de nyid du rdo rje skyil @51b krung gis sa'i lha mo'i gzugs 'chad par 'gyur ba bsams nas /
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i sngags bzlas shing yungs kar dang chu dang thal ba rnams kyis sa la bsang gtor byas la de nyid du rdo rje skyil @51b krung gis sa'i lha mo'i gzugs 'chad par 'gyur ba bsams nas /
translated: Then, in that very place, one should imagine the form of Pṛthivī, the goddess of the site, sitting in vajra posture,

original: zhabs bsil la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can /
analyzed: zhabs bsil la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can /
translated: and having first offered the foot bath, and so on,

original: tshur gshegs tshur gshegs zhes pa la sogs pas lan gsum du gsol ba btab pas de ltar gyis shig ces brjod nas nam mkhar bzhengs par bltas te /
analyzed: tshur gshegs tshur gshegs zhes pa la sogs pas lan gsum du gsol ba btab pas de ltar gyis shig ces brjod nas nam mkhar bzhengs par bltas te /
translated: Having invited three times with Come here, come here, and so on, [the deities] say, Do it like that, and one should visualize them rising into the sky.

original: da ni bgegs dang bral ba'i sa yin no zhes shes par byas la /
analyzed: da ni bgegs dang bral ba'i sa yin no zhes shes par byas la /
translated: Now, having understood, This is the site free from obstructors,

original: gtor ma byin nas sa bdag klu nges par bya ste brko ba la sogs pa rung ba las brko ba la sogs pa bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gtor ma byin nas sa bdag klu nges par bya ste brko ba la sogs pa rung ba las brko ba la sogs pa bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: one should give the bali and examine the site and nāgas, and one should dig and so on, having ascertained that it is suitable to dig and so on.

original: de la sa bdag brtag pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sa bdag brtag pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The examination of the site is as follows:

original: dkyil 'khor gyi sa la dkyil 'khor nyis 'gyur gyi tshad kyis mandala gru bzhi byas te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi sa la dkyil 'khor nyis 'gyur gyi tshad kyis mandala gru bzhi byas te /
translated: In the site of the maṇḍala, make a square maṇḍala with a size double that of the maṇḍala.

original: thams cad re'u mig dgu bcu byas la /
analyzed: thams cad re'u mig dgu bcu byas la /
translated: Make all of it into ninety squares.

original: der sa bdag klu khrums dang mgo dang dbo dang snron la sogs pa zla ba gsum gsum la rim pas shar dang lho'i phyogs su mgo dang lho la sogs par kha bltas shing nyal ba'i lus re'u mig dgu khyab pa ste /
analyzed: der sa bdag klu khrums dang mgo dang dbo dang snron la sogs pa zla ba gsum gsum la rim pas shar dang lho'i phyogs su mgo dang lho la sogs par kha bltas shing nyal ba'i lus re'u mig dgu khyab pa ste /
translated: There, the site-lord nāgas—Puṣya, Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Āśleṣā, and so on—lie down in three months each, in sequence, in the east and south, facing east and so on, their bodies covering nine squares.

original: khrums la sogs pa'i dgu bcur zhag dgu bcu rnams la so sor re'u mig re re gnon pa 'das pa'i nyin gyi dbyu gu rnam par dbye bas kyang 'gro ba brtags la /
analyzed: khrums la sogs pa'i dgu bcur zhag dgu bcu rnams la so sor re'u mig re re gnon pa 'das pa'i nyin gyi dbyu gu rnam par dbye bas kyang 'gro ba brtags la /
translated: In the ninety days of the winter solstice and so forth, one should press down on each square for each day. One should also examine the movement of the planets on the day of the examination.

original: mgo'i phyogs la re'u mig nyi shu 'am nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / lto bar yang re'u mig gnyis sam gsum yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: mgo'i phyogs la re'u mig nyi shu 'am nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / lto bar yang re'u mig gnyis sam gsum yongs su spangs te /
translated: Having avoided twenty or twenty-one squares in the head area and two or three squares in the navel area,

original: rgyab dang mjug ma yang nges par byas nas lto bar brko bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgyab dang mjug ma yang nges par byas nas lto bar brko bar bya ste /
translated: one should dig in the navel area, having ascertained the back and the tail.

original: dngos grub dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi dbye ba las pus mo dang dpyi dang lte ba ji srid par zhes ba sa brko ba'o //
analyzed: dngos grub dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi dbye ba las pus mo dang dpyi dang lte ba ji srid par zhes ba sa brko ba'o //
translated: One should dig to the knee, hip, or navel, according to whether the siddhi is lesser, middling, or greater.

original: de nas sa'i ro bsal la dri bzang po'i chu dang ldan pa'i sa de nyid kyis dong dgang ste ma khengs na gzhan gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: de nas sa'i ro bsal la dri bzang po'i chu dang ldan pa'i sa de nyid kyis dong dgang ste ma khengs na gzhan gyis kyang ngo //
translated: Then, having removed the taste of the earth, one should fill the hole with that same earth mixed with fragrant water. If it is not full, one should fill it with other earth.

original: las thams cad pa'i sngags bzlas pa'i dri bzang po'i chu yis bran cing brdungs la /
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i sngags bzlas pa'i dri bzang po'i chu yis bran cing brdungs la /
translated: One should sprinkle and pound it with fragrant water, incanting it with the mantra of all activities.

original: khru phyed mtho ba rus sbal gyi rgyab lta bu dbang ldan du cung zad dma' ba bya'o //
analyzed: khru phyed mtho ba rus sbal gyi rgyab lta bu dbang ldan du cung zad dma' ba bya'o //
translated: It should be half a cubit high, like the back of a tortoise, and slightly lower in the northeast.

original: khang bzang la sogs par ni brko ba la sogs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: khang bzang la sogs par ni brko ba la sogs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: In a mansion and so forth, there is no digging and so forth.

original: lag pa reg ste h'um yig bzlas nas sngar bzhin thal ba la sogs pas bsang gtor byas la /
analyzed: lag pa reg ste h'um yig bzlas nas sngar bzhin thal ba la sogs pas bsang gtor byas la /
translated: Touching it with the hand, one should recite the syllable HŪM, and as before, one should sprinkle it with the ash and so forth.

original: shar gyi phyogs nas brtsams te ba'i rnam lngas legs par byugs @52a * //
analyzed: shar gyi phyogs nas brtsams te ba'i rnam lngas legs par byugs @52a * //
translated: Beginning from the east, one should anoint it well with the five cow products.

original: la dri'i chus bran par bya'o //
analyzed: la dri'i chus bran par bya'o //
translated: One should sprinkle it with scented water.

original: de bas brko ba la sogs pas dag pa'am gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bas brko ba la sogs pas dag pa'am gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, one should purify it with digging and so forth, or else,

original: aom bh'um kham zhes brjod la nam mkhar byas nas h'um lam h'um zhes pa 'dis rdo rje'i rang bzhin du rnam par bsgoms te /🔽aom me di ni badzr'i bh'a ba badzra bandha h'um ;
analyzed: aom bh'um kham zhes brjod la nam mkhar byas nas h'um lam h'um zhes pa 'dis rdo rje'i rang bzhin du rnam par bsgoms te / aom me di ni badzr'i bh'a ba badzra bandha h'um ;
translated: having made it into space with the utterance of OṂ BHŪR BHUVAH SVAH, one should visualize it as having the nature of a vajra with this [verse]:🔽OṂ, the light of the vajra, bind the vajra, HŪM.

original: aom ha na ha na badzra kro dha h'um phat /
analyzed: aom ha na ha na badzra kro dha h'um phat /
translated: OṂ, the wrathful vajra, HANA HANA, HŪM PHAṬ.

original: aom a'a: h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um /
translated: OṂ AḤ HŪM.

original: sho dha ya sho dha ya raksha raksha h'um phat /
analyzed: sho dha ya sho dha ya raksha raksha h'um phat /
translated: Purify, purify, protect, protect, HŪM PHAṬ.

original: zhes pa'i sngags gsum gyis lag pa reg la byin gyis brlab cing las thams cad pa'i sngags bzlas te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags gsum gyis lag pa reg la byin gyis brlab cing las thams cad pa'i sngags bzlas te /
translated: One should bless the hands by touching them with the three mantras.

original: rin po che dang sman dang 'bru dang snying po lnga rnams sbas pa'i sa dri'i chus byugs par gtor ma dang mchod yon sngon du 'gro bas nam mkhar gnas pa'i sa'i lha mo nang du bsgoms nas /
analyzed: rin po che dang sman dang 'bru dang snying po lnga rnams sbas pa'i sa dri'i chus byugs par gtor ma dang mchod yon sngon du 'gro bas nam mkhar gnas pa'i sa'i lha mo nang du bsgoms nas /
translated: One should sprinkle the ground with water in which the five essences have been hidden, and which has the smell of the earth, with a sacrificial cake and a libation preceding it.

original: aom a'a: h'um brjod cing pad kor sngon du 'gro ba'i yi ge brgya pa brjod par bya'o zhes pa sa sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um brjod cing pad kor sngon du 'gro ba'i yi ge brgya pa brjod par bya'o zhes pa sa sbyang ba'o //
translated: One should visualize the earth goddess in space, and recite the one hundred syllables, preceded by the lotus roll, saying om aḥ hūṃ.

original: de nas me tog gis mngon par gtor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su 'dug ste rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas 'dri bar 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i srung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pa bya ste bgegs bcom nas spos phor bzung
analyzed: de nas me tog gis mngon par gtor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su 'dug ste rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas 'dri bar 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i srung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pa bya ste bgegs bcom nas spos phor bzung
translated: Then, having scattered flowers, one should sit in the center of the mandala ground, holding the vajra and bell, and one should perform the protection wheel and so forth, endowed with the yoga of the mandala to be drawn, and having conquered the obstructors, one should hold the incense burner.

original: ste / h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje'i lce can gyis//
analyzed: ste / h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje'i lce can gyis//
translated: With the vajra tongue born from hūṃ,

original: ma lus phyogs na bzhugs pa yi //
analyzed: ma lus phyogs na bzhugs pa yi //
translated: All the buddhas dwelling in all directions,

original: sangs rgyas bdag la dgongs su gsol //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bdag la dgongs su gsol //
translated: please heed me!

original: che ge yi ni rdo rje bdag //
analyzed: che ge yi ni rdo rje bdag //
translated: I, so-and-so, am the vajra master

original: 'dir ni dkyil 'khor bri bar bgyid //
analyzed: 'dir ni dkyil 'khor bri bar bgyid //
translated: here, who will draw the maṇḍala.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs kun byon la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs kun byon la //
translated: All buddhas and so forth, please come

original: 'dir ni dngos grub rab tu stsol //
analyzed: 'dir ni dngos grub rab tu stsol //
translated: and grant spiritual powers here.

original: zhes rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa spyan drangs te mchod pas mchod nas nam mkhar bzhugs pa la sogs pa dang de'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i slob ma rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu dang bcas pa phyogs bzhir gnas pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: zhes rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa spyan drangs te mchod pas mchod nas nam mkhar bzhugs pa la sogs pa dang de'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i slob ma rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu dang bcas pa phyogs bzhir gnas pa rnams kyis /
translated: Having invited the perfect buddhas and so forth, and having made offerings with offerings, the disciples who are endowed with the yoga of dwelling in space and so forth, and who are abiding in the four directions with vajra and vajra bell,🔽should request the maṇḍala to be explained:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhi ba //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhi ba //
translated: All tathāgatas are peace,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas//
translated: the abode of all tathāgatas,🔽the supreme of all selfless phenomena—

original: bdag med chos rnams kun gyi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //🔽mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag rdzogs //
analyzed: bdag med chos rnams kun gyi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol // mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag rdzogs //
translated: please explain the sacred maṇḍala.🔽All characteristics are perfectly complete,

original: mtshan nyid ma yin thams cad spangs //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma yin thams cad spangs //
translated: all non-characteristics are abandoned,

original: kun du bzang po sku yi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
analyzed: kun du bzang po sku yi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
translated: please explain the sacred mandala.

original: chos mchog zhi ba las byung @52b zhing ;
analyzed: chos mchog zhi ba las byung @52b zhing ;
translated: Arisen from the supreme peace of phenomena,

original: / ye shes spyod pa rnam sbyong ba //
analyzed: / ye shes spyod pa rnam sbyong ba //
translated: purifying the conduct of wisdom,🔽Samantabhadra, supreme speech,

original: kun du bzang po gsung gi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
analyzed: kun du bzang po gsung gi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
translated: please explain the sacred mandala.

original: sems can kun gyi sems chen po //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi sems chen po //
translated: The great mind of all sentient beings,

original: rang bzhin dag pa dri ma med //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pa dri ma med //
translated: pure by nature, stainless,🔽Samantabhadra, supreme conduct,

original: kun du bzang po spyod pa'i mchog / dkyil 'khor kha lo bsgyur bshad gsol //
analyzed: kun du bzang po spyod pa'i mchog / dkyil 'khor kha lo bsgyur bshad gsol //
translated: please explain the mandala of the charioteer.

original: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bdag nyid la gsol ba gdab par bya zhing dngos su med na bsams nas kyang ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bdag nyid la gsol ba gdab par bya zhing dngos su med na bsams nas kyang ste /
translated: With these four verses, one should make supplications to oneself. If one is not actually present, one should imagine it.

original: de ltar gnas nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa spro ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can bsgoms pa'i lha'i 'khor lo rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis mdzub mo gnyis brkyang zhing rtse mo sprad pa 'og tu kha bltas pa spyi bor bzhag ste
analyzed: de ltar gnas nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa spro ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can bsgoms pa'i lha'i 'khor lo rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis mdzub mo gnyis brkyang zhing rtse mo sprad pa 'og tu kha bltas pa spyi bor bzhag ste
translated: From that state, having emanated the mandala wheel and so forth, one should meditate on the deity wheel with the two vajra fists with the two index fingers extended and touching at the tips, facing downward, placed on the crown.

original: / h'um badzrod tishtha zhes pa brjod de nam mkhar btegs nas rang nyid langs te kha shar du bltas la rkang pa mnyam par gnas pa'i spyi bor thal mo sbyar bas rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal nas skad cig gis khro bo rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sku
analyzed: / h'um badzrod tishtha zhes pa brjod de nam mkhar btegs nas rang nyid langs te kha shar du bltas la rkang pa mnyam par gnas pa'i spyi bor thal mo sbyar bas rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal nas skad cig gis khro bo rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sku
translated: In an instant, one should assume the form of the wrathful Vajra Humkara,

original: smin ma bsnyer ba mche ba gtsigs pa 'gying ba dang bcas par bya ste /
analyzed: smin ma bsnyer ba mche ba gtsigs pa 'gying ba dang bcas par bya ste /
translated: with furrowed brow, bared fangs, and swaying.🔽From the syllables MA and DA in the right and left eyes, one should visualize the forms of the sun and moon, and with the syllable HUM, one should make the eyeballs blaze like the fire at the end of time.

original: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i mig dag ma dang da yig las nyi ma dang zla ba'i gzugs dang / h'um yig gis mig 'bras gnyis bskal pa'i me ltar byas la phyogs thams cad du rdo rje'i lta stangs kyis blta zhing nga rgyal bya ste /🔽nga ni rang nyid rdo rje can //
analyzed: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i mig dag ma dang da yig las nyi ma dang zla ba'i gzugs dang / h'um yig gis mig 'bras gnyis bskal pa'i me ltar byas la phyogs thams cad du rdo rje'i lta stangs kyis blta zhing nga rgyal bya ste / nga ni rang nyid rdo rje can //
translated: One should look in all directions with the vajra gaze and assume the following pride:🔽I am the very Vajra Holder,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rang nyid nga //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rang nyid nga //
translated: I am the very Vajrasattva,

original: nga ni sangs rgyas rgyal po che //
analyzed: nga ni sangs rgyas rgyal po che //
translated: I am the great king of the buddhas,

original: nga ni stobs chen rdo rje can //
analyzed: nga ni stobs chen rdo rje can //
translated: I am the very powerful Vajra Holder.

original: rnal 'byor dbang phyug rgyal po nga //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang phyug rgyal po nga //
translated: I am the lord of yogins, the king.

original: nga ni phyag na rdo rje brtan //
analyzed: nga ni phyag na rdo rje brtan //
translated: I am the firm Vajrapani.

original: zhes pa'o ; / de nas rkang pa'i mthil du rdo rje 'bar ba bsgoms te /
analyzed: zhes pa'o ; / de nas rkang pa'i mthil du rdo rje 'bar ba bsgoms te /
translated: Then, having meditated on a blazing vajra on the soles of the feet,

original: 'gying pa dang bcas par pad kor sngon du 'gro bas rdo rje gsor zhing dril bu dkrol ba dang bcas par rdo rje'i rkang stabs kyis dbang ldan du song ste /
analyzed: 'gying pa dang bcas par pad kor sngon du 'gro bas rdo rje gsor zhing dril bu dkrol ba dang bcas par rdo rje'i rkang stabs kyis dbang ldan du song ste /
translated: one should go to the northeast with the vajra gait, brandishing the vajra and ringing the bell, preceded by the lotus roll.

original: de nas brtsams nas g-yas skor du rdo rje'i rkang stabs la sogs pa rnams kyis ji ltar nus pa'i gar byed cing gzhan du dengs zhes pa la sogs pa lan gsum brjod la /
analyzed: de nas brtsams nas g-yas skor du rdo rje'i rkang stabs la sogs pa rnams kyis ji ltar nus pa'i gar byed cing gzhan du dengs zhes pa la sogs pa lan gsum brjod la /
translated: Then, beginning from there, one should dance with the vajra gait and so on, circling to the right, as much as one can, and say three times, “Depart elsewhere” and so on.

original: spros pa'i khro bo mtha' yas pa rnams kyis bgegs tshar bcad nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi sa 'og la thug par rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: spros pa'i khro bo mtha' yas pa rnams kyis bgegs tshar bcad nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi sa 'og la thug par rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Having annihilated the obstructors with infinite wrathful ones emanated from oneself, one should bless the ground of the maṇḍala as far as the underworld as having the nature of vajras.

original: @53a * // de nas ji ltar nus pa dang ji ltar 'dod par gar bya'o //
analyzed: @53a * // de nas ji ltar nus pa dang ji ltar 'dod par gar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should dance as much as one can and as much as one likes.

original: nus pa med pa'am mi 'dod na gar ma byas kyang skyon med do zhes pa sa yongs su gzung ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa med pa'am mi 'dod na gar ma byas kyang skyon med do zhes pa sa yongs su gzung ba'o //
translated: If one is not able or does not wish to do that, there is no fault if one does not dance.

original: de nas 'gro ba rdo rje 'chang nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir bgegs med par bya'o zhes rnam par bsams te /🔽skad cig gis stong pa nyid kyi de ma thag par ram las skyes pa'i nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje la gnas pa'i h'um gi 'od zer las skyes pa'i rdo rje rnams kyis rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis gzhi dang ra ba
analyzed: de nas 'gro ba rdo rje 'chang nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir bgegs med par bya'o zhes rnam par bsams te / skad cig gis stong pa nyid kyi de ma thag par ram las skyes pa'i nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje la gnas pa'i h'um gi 'od zer las skyes pa'i rdo rje rnams kyis rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis gzhi dang ra ba
translated: Then, in order to attain the state of Vajradhara, one should think, “I will be free of obstacles.”

original: dang gur dang bla re dang mda'i dra ba rnams bskyed de /
analyzed: dang gur dang bla re dang mda'i dra ba rnams bskyed de /
translated: Immediately after emptiness, or arisen from that, on a sun is a hūṃ, from which arises a vajra cross, on which is a hūṃ. From the light rays of the hūṃ arise vajras, which create the ground, the fence, the pavilion, the canopy, and the net of arrows, all of vajra nature.

original: skad cig gis rdo rje sems dpa' gzhan du gyur nas /
analyzed: skad cig gis rdo rje sems dpa' gzhan du gyur nas /
translated: In an instant, one transforms into Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad sna tshogs chu skyes dang nyi ma la gnas pa 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan mnan pa /

analyzed: g-yas pa dag gis lcags gyu dang zhags pa /

analyzed: lag pa g-yas par zla ba la h'um gsum bsams nas /
