original: sor mo'i rtse mo gsum bsnun pas de'i sgra dang sngags kyi 'od zer rnams kyis kyang bskul nas 'thon pa'i ye shes sems dpa'i gzugs dang sa'i lha mo lhan cig tu gyur te /
analyzed: sor mo'i rtse mo gsum bsnun pas de'i sgra dang sngags kyi 'od zer rnams kyis kyang bskul nas 'thon pa'i ye shes sems dpa'i gzugs dang sa'i lha mo lhan cig tu gyur te /
translated: Having been urged by the sound and the light rays of the mantra, the form of the exalted wisdom being emerges together with the goddess of the earth.

original: dga' ba dang 'brel ba'i thugs can ser mo zhi ba na bza' dkar mo rgyan sna tshogs dang ldan pa g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi phyag gnyis kyis gser gyi rang bzhin gyi bum pa bzang po 'dzin pa dang mi 'jigs pa /
analyzed: dga' ba dang 'brel ba'i thugs can ser mo zhi ba na bza' dkar mo rgyan sna tshogs dang ldan pa g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi phyag gnyis kyis gser gyi rang bzhin gyi bum pa bzang po 'dzin pa dang mi 'jigs pa /
translated: She is yellow, peaceful, and has a delighted mind, is dressed in white garments, is adorned with various ornaments, and holds in her two left and right hands an excellent vase made of gold and a boon.

original: zhal gcig ma'i mdun du 'dug pa la mchod yon la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod de gus pa dang bcas par /🔽aom tshur gshegs tshur gshegs sa yi ni //
analyzed: zhal gcig ma'i mdun du 'dug pa la mchod yon la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod de gus pa dang bcas par / aom tshur gshegs tshur gshegs sa yi ni //
translated: She sits in front of the one with one face, and having made offerings with water for welcoming and so forth, one should make a request with devotion:

original: lha mo chen mo 'jig @55a * //
analyzed: lha mo chen mo 'jig @55a * //
translated: Oṃ, come, come, great goddess of the earth,🔽mother of the world,

original: rten yum // rin chen rang bzhin kun gyis gang //
analyzed: rten yum // rin chen rang bzhin kun gyis gang //
translated: filled with all jewels,

original: lha yi rgyan gyis brgyan pa yi //
analyzed: lha yi rgyan gyis brgyan pa yi //
translated: adorned with divine ornaments,

original: do shal rkang gdub sgra dang ldan //
analyzed: do shal rkang gdub sgra dang ldan //
translated: with the sound of necklaces and anklets,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rab mchod ma //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rab mchod ma //
translated: making offerings to Vajrasattva,

original: mchod yon 'di ni bzhes nas su //
analyzed: mchod yon 'di ni bzhes nas su //
translated: Having accepted this water for welcoming,

original: dkyil 'khor bya ba legs par sgrubs //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bya ba legs par sgrubs //
translated: accomplish well the performance of the maṇḍala.

original: h'i hi hi hi h'am sv'a h'a ;
analyzed: h'i hi hi hi h'am sv'a h'a ;
translated: Hī hī hī hī hāṃ svāhā.

original: zhes pa lan gsum brjod de spyan drangs pa dang nang du nye bar gnas par gsol ba'i lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa lan gsum brjod de spyan drangs pa dang nang du nye bar gnas par gsol ba'i lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having invited with the utterance of this three times, one should perform the consecration of the resident deities who have been requested to remain.

original: de yang de ltar mdzod ces brjod nas de nyid du thim par bsams te rdo rje bcing ba 'og tu byas la des sa gzhi mnan la /
analyzed: de yang de ltar mdzod ces brjod nas de nyid du thim par bsams te rdo rje bcing ba 'og tu byas la des sa gzhi mnan la /
translated: Having said, “You should do just that,” one should imagine that they dissolve into just that, and having made the vajra bond below, one should press down on the ground with it.

original: aom badzr'i bha ba h'um lan gsum mngon par bsngags te rdo rje bcing ba las mngon par mthon pa'i h'um yig 'bar ba'i tshogs rnams kyis sa 'og gi bar du rdo rjer byas par bsgoms la /
analyzed: aom badzr'i bha ba h'um lan gsum mngon par bsngags te rdo rje bcing ba las mngon par mthon pa'i h'um yig 'bar ba'i tshogs rnams kyis sa 'og gi bar du rdo rjer byas par bsgoms la /
translated: Having blessed it with the utterance of Oṃ vajrī bhava, hūṃ three times, one should imagine that the hūṃ syllable that has arisen from the vajra bond has become a vajra as far as the underworld through the mass of flames, and

original: aom badzra dri dha tishtha zhes pa lan gsum brjod cing byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
analyzed: aom badzra dri dha tishtha zhes pa lan gsum brjod cing byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
translated: one should bless it with the utterance of Oṃ vajra dṛdhīthitha three times.

original: de ltar sa rang nyid kyir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sa rang nyid kyir 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, the ground becomes one’s own.

original: nor 'dzin ma lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: nor 'dzin ma lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of consecrating the ground.

original: de nas sa de dri la sogs pas byug cing me tog rnams gtor ba'i shar du 'dug nas /
analyzed: de nas sa de dri la sogs pas byug cing me tog rnams gtor ba'i shar du 'dug nas /
translated: Then, having anointed the ground with perfume and so forth and scattered flowers, one should sit in the east.

original: nub du bltas te dbus su bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa'i dri rnams kyis gtso bo la sogs pa lnga'i gnas su gru bzhi dang gzhan rnams la zlum po'i mandala byas la ;
analyzed: nub du bltas te dbus su bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa'i dri rnams kyis gtso bo la sogs pa lnga'i gnas su gru bzhi dang gzhan rnams la zlum po'i mandala byas la ;
translated: Facing west, one should make a square maṇḍala in the center with perfume and the five elixirs for the principal and the others, and round maṇḍalas for the others.

original: de rang rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i bcom ldan 'das spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de rang rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i bcom ldan 'das spyan drangs te /
translated: Having invited the Bhagavān with the light rays of the seed syllable in one’s heart,

original: mchod yon la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas yang dag par mchod cing bstod de bdud rtsi myangs nas pus mo g-yas pa sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: mchod yon la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas yang dag par mchod cing bstod de bdud rtsi myangs nas pus mo g-yas pa sa la btsugs te /
translated: having made perfect offerings with water for the feet, and so on, and having praised, one should taste the elixir and touch one’s right knee to the ground.

original: h'um las skyes shing des byin gyis brlabs pa'i lce rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang lag pa g-yas par spos phor thogs te /
analyzed: h'um las skyes shing des byin gyis brlabs pa'i lce rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang lag pa g-yas par spos phor thogs te /
translated: One should visualize a single-pointed vajra on the tongue, generated from hūṃ and blessed by it, and hold an incense burner in one’s right hand.

original: g-yon pas dril bu 'khrol zhing /
analyzed: g-yon pas dril bu 'khrol zhing /
translated: Shaking a bell with one’s left hand,🔽one should recite:🔽I pay homage and praise the Bhagavān,🔽the supreme Vajra Queen,

original: bcom ldan 'das bde mchog rdo rje mchog / rig pa'i rgyal po phyag 'tshal bstod //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bde mchog rdo rje mchog / rig pa'i rgyal po phyag 'tshal bstod //
translated: the king of knowledge.

original: mgon po thugs rje'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: mgon po thugs rje'i bdag nyid can //
translated: Protector, you who are the embodiment of compassion,

original: dkyil 'khor dag ni 'bri bar 'tshal //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dag ni 'bri bar 'tshal //
translated: I wish to draw the maṇḍala.🔽For the sake of compassion for sentient beings

original: sems can rnams la brtse don dang // khyed rnams la ni mchod phyir yang //
analyzed: sems can rnams la brtse don dang // khyed rnams la ni mchod phyir yang //
translated: and for the sake of worshipping you all,

original: bdag gus de la bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: bdag gus de la bcom ldan 'das //
translated: I am devoted to this, O Blessed One.

original: bka' drin dag ni bya bar 'os //
analyzed: bka' drin dag ni bya bar 'os //
translated: It is fitting that you show me your kindness.

original: bdag la dgongs mdzod sangs rgyas ni //
analyzed: bdag la dgongs mdzod sangs rgyas ni //
translated: Please pay attention, O Buddha,

original: 'gro pa'i 'khor lo bya don stsol //
analyzed: 'gro pa'i 'khor lo bya don stsol //
translated: who strives to benefit the world.🔽To the bodhisattvas who abide in the result,🔽and to the other mantra deities,🔽to the gods and world protectors,

original: byang chub sems @55b dba' 'bras gnas dang // gang gzhan sngags kyi lha rnams dang // lha dang 'jig rten skyong rnams dang // 'byung po rdzogs pa'i byang chub gnas //
analyzed: byang chub sems @55b dba' 'bras gnas dang // gang gzhan sngags kyi lha rnams dang // lha dang 'jig rten skyong rnams dang // 'byung po rdzogs pa'i byang chub gnas //
translated: and to the beings who abide in perfect enlightenment,🔽to those who delight in the teachings of sentient beings,

original: sems can bstan la mngon dga' dang // gang su lha yi spyan mnga' rnams //
analyzed: sems can bstan la mngon dga' dang // gang su lha yi spyan mnga' rnams //
translated: and to those who possess the divine eye,

original: bdag ni che ge rdo rje che //
analyzed: bdag ni che ge rdo rje che //
translated: I, so-and-so, the great vajra,

original: bde mchog 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor ni //
analyzed: bde mchog 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor ni //
translated: in the maṇḍala of the origin of Cakrasaṃvara,

original: nye 'khor ji ltar nus pa las //
analyzed: nye 'khor ji ltar nus pa las //
translated: to the best of my ability,

original: 'gro ba sbyang slad bri bar bgyi //
analyzed: 'gro ba sbyang slad bri bar bgyi //
translated: will draw it for the sake of purifying beings.

original: de phyir slob mar bcas bdag la //
analyzed: de phyir slob mar bcas bdag la //
translated: Therefore, for myself and my disciples,

original: rjes su brtse bas nyer bzung ste //
analyzed: rjes su brtse bas nyer bzung ste //
translated: Having taken them with compassion,

original: dkyil 'khor dang bcas thams cad ni //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang bcas thams cad ni //
translated: all of them together with the maṇḍala

original: nye bar gnas par mdzad par 'os //
analyzed: nye bar gnas par mdzad par 'os //
translated: are worthy to be present.

original: zhes pa don yid la brnags pas lan gsum brjod cing gsol ba gdab par bya'o zhes pa lha lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa don yid la brnags pas lan gsum brjod cing gsol ba gdab par bya'o zhes pa lha lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Having contemplated the meaning, one should recite this supplication three times. This is the rite of the special abidance of the deity.

original: de nas lhag par gnas pa'i lha'i 'khor lo yang dag par mchod de ye shes kyi thig la sogs pa'i don du dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i steng gi nam mkhar bkod la rang gis dbang bskur pa'i slob ma kho na sgo'i slob dpon bzhi dang las kyi rdo rje
analyzed: de nas lhag par gnas pa'i lha'i 'khor lo yang dag par mchod de ye shes kyi thig la sogs pa'i don du dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i steng gi nam mkhar bkod la rang gis dbang bskur pa'i slob ma kho na sgo'i slob dpon bzhi dang las kyi rdo rje
translated: Then, having made offerings to the wheel of the deities of the special abidance, in order to perform the gnosis lines, and so on, having arranged them in the sky above the maṇḍala ground, the disciples who have been empowered by oneself, the four door masters, and the one vajra action

original: gcig gis dbye bas lnga rnams dang med na gcig gis kyang ste /
analyzed: gcig gis dbye bas lnga rnams dang med na gcig gis kyang ste /
translated: make five [disciples] enter, or if there is no one, then one.

original: shar du kha bltas pa dkyil 'khor gyi dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas /
analyzed: shar du kha bltas pa dkyil 'khor gyi dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas /
translated: Facing east, endowed with the yoga of the lord of the maṇḍala,

original: gzhon nu mas byas pa'i srad bu lnga lnga rnams snod lngar bzhag la /
analyzed: gzhon nu mas byas pa'i srad bu lnga lnga rnams snod lngar bzhag la /
translated: five sets of five strings made by a young girl are placed in five vessels.

original: dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu dang nag po dang dri dang kha dog bzang po rnams dang yung skar dang bdud rtsi lnga bsres pa so so so sor kha bsgyur te /
analyzed: dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu dang nag po dang dri dang kha dog bzang po rnams dang yung skar dang bdud rtsi lnga bsres pa so so so sor kha bsgyur te /
translated: white, yellow, red, green, black, good smell, good color, and the five nectars mixed with the five stars.

original: lag pa g-yon pa'i sor mo'i rtse mo na sa mthe bor gyi rta bar ji srid par rim pas bkod la //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa'i sor mo'i rtse mo na sa mthe bor gyi rta bar ji srid par rim pas bkod la //
translated: Arrange them in order on the tips of the fingers of the left hand, from the thumb to the little finger.🔽From bhrūṃ, oṃ, hrīḥ, hā, and hūṃ, the five complete tathāgatas arise in the space, and the tathāgatas of the individual directions gather into the five tathāgatas.

original: bh'um aom hr'i: h'a h'um las skyes pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rdzogs pa nam mkhar bzhugs pa rang rang gi phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus par gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i thugs ka rnams su bhr'um la sogs pa las skyes pa'i 'od zer gyi
analyzed: bh'um aom hr'i: h'a h'um las skyes pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rdzogs pa nam mkhar bzhugs pa rang rang gi phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus par gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i thugs ka rnams su bhr'um la sogs pa las skyes pa'i 'od zer gyi
translated: Visualize the light rays that arise from bhrūṃ and so on in the hearts of the five tathāgatas,

original: rang bzhin ye shes kyi srad bu rnams bltas nas /
analyzed: rang bzhin ye shes kyi srad bu rnams bltas nas /
translated: the nature of the wisdom thread.

original: aom a'a: sh'a shva ta badzra s'u tram me pra yatstsha ma h'a mandala s'u tra n'a ya h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: sh'a shva ta badzra s'u tram me pra yatstsha ma h'a mandala s'u tra n'a ya h'um /
translated: oṃ āḥ śāśvata vajra sūtraṃ me pra yaccha mahāmaṇḍalasūtra nāya hūṃ

original: zhes pa 'di yis brtag pa'i ming yongs su bsgyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di yis brtag pa'i ming yongs su bsgyur te /
translated: Transform the name of the thread.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa rnams la yang gsol ba btab la /
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa rnams la yang gsol ba btab la /
translated: Also supplicate Ratnasambhava and so forth.

original: dza: yig las skyes pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma ser po'i mig @56a * //
analyzed: dza: yig las skyes pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma ser po'i mig @56a * //
translated: The two eyes are yellow moon and sun generated from the letters jra and va.🔽Recite oṃ dīpta-dṛṣṭi-aṅkuśa jaḥ.

original: gnyis ; aom d'ipta drishta aam ku shi dz'a: zhes brjod cing mig shin tu myur bar g-yo ba rdzi ma 'debs pa 'bar ba'i spyan gyi lta stangs lcags kyu lta bus rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bskul te /
analyzed: gnyis ; aom d'ipta drishta aam ku shi dz'a: zhes brjod cing mig shin tu myur bar g-yo ba rdzi ma 'debs pa 'bar ba'i spyan gyi lta stangs lcags kyu lta bus rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bskul te /
translated: With the eyes moving very quickly, the eyebrows moving, and the gaze of the blazing eyes like a hook, arouse Akṣobhya and so forth.

original: rang gi lag par gnas pa'i srad bu rnams la ji lta ba bzhin bcug nas /
analyzed: rang gi lag par gnas pa'i srad bu rnams la ji lta ba bzhin bcug nas /
translated: Having inserted the threads that are held in one’s hand into the center of the five-colored thread,

original: dum skyes ma'i gzugs kyis slob ma dang lhan cig aom aa no n+ya aa nu ga t'a: sarba dharm'a: spha ra spha ra aa nu phra pisht'a: sarba dharm'a aa tyan ta aa nu pra bisht'a: sarba dharm'a aom a'a: h'um zhes pa brjod cing thog mar srad bu lnga
analyzed: dum skyes ma'i gzugs kyis slob ma dang lhan cig aom aa no n+ya aa nu ga t'a: sarba dharm'a: spha ra spha ra aa nu phra pisht'a: sarba dharm'a aa tyan ta aa nu pra bisht'a: sarba dharm'a aom a'a: h'um zhes pa brjod cing thog mar srad bu lnga
translated: recite oṃ a-no-nya-anu-gāta sarva-dharmā spharaṇa-sphāra-anu-praviṣṭa sarva-dharmā a-tyanta-anu-praviṣṭa sarva-dharmā oṃ āḥ hūṃ.

original: lnga re re rab sgril nas lnga rnams gcig tu bsgril bar bya'o //
analyzed: lnga re re rab sgril nas lnga rnams gcig tu bsgril bar bya'o //
translated: First, the five threads are each twisted into a single thread.

original: bla ma dang slob ma'i lag pas non pa lhag pa'i cha ma gtogs pa ring ba dkyil 'khor nyis 'gyur dang / sboms su sgo'i nyi shu cha ji lta ba bzhin 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla ma dang slob ma'i lag pas non pa lhag pa'i cha ma gtogs pa ring ba dkyil 'khor nyis 'gyur dang / sboms su sgo'i nyi shu cha ji lta ba bzhin 'gyur ro //
translated: Except for the excess of the guru and disciple's hands, the distance is twice the mandala, and the thickness is one twenty-fourth of the door.

original: de'i rjes la sngar gyi sa gzhir dri nye bar byugs pa'i snod gtsang mar dri bzangs la sogs pas spangs la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la sngar gyi sa gzhir dri nye bar byugs pa'i snod gtsang mar dri bzangs la sogs pas spangs la /
translated: After that, in the previously prepared ground, in a clean vessel anointed with saffron, one should offer flowers, etc.,

original: yi ge gsum dang ldan pa me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mngon par mchod de /🔽lag pas mnan la dum skyes mas bsrungs nas g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi mig dag la /
analyzed: yi ge gsum dang ldan pa me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mngon par mchod de / lag pas mnan la dum skyes mas bsrungs nas g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi mig dag la /
translated: endowed with the three syllables.🔽Pressing with the hand, protected by Khaṇḍarohā, one should look at the right and left eyes,

original: ma dang ta yig las skyes pa'i nyi ma dang zla ba blta zhing sngar bzhin badzra drishti ma ta ces brtan par byas la khanda ro ha bzlas pa'i bdud rtsi'i chu bran te /
analyzed: ma dang ta yig las skyes pa'i nyi ma dang zla ba blta zhing sngar bzhin badzra drishti ma ta ces brtan par byas la khanda ro ha bzlas pa'i bdud rtsi'i chu bran te /
translated: which are arisen from the letters ma and ta, the sun and moon, respectively, and as before, one should stabilize with vajra-dṛṣṭi māta.

original: lag pa g-yas pa rdo rje dang bcas pas reg cing aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tra m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes pa 'di bzlas nas yi ge gsum brgyad dang bcas pa brgya rtsa bsngags la lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa rdo rje dang bcas pas reg cing aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tra m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes pa 'di bzlas nas yi ge gsum brgyad dang bcas pa brgya rtsa bsngags la lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: Touching with the right hand together with the vajra, one should recite this, “Oṃ vajra samaya sūtra mati kṛtaṃ hūṃ.” Having recited this together with the three syllables eight hundred times, one should consecrate it.

original: de nas aom sarba sam sho dha ni h'um phat ces pa'i sngags kyis dang / bum pa thams cad kyi chus mandala lnga byas pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par dbye bar sa la bsang gtor bya ste /
analyzed: de nas aom sarba sam sho dha ni h'um phat ces pa'i sngags kyis dang / bum pa thams cad kyi chus mandala lnga byas pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par dbye bar sa la bsang gtor bya ste /
translated: Then, with the mantra, “Oṃ sarva śodhani hūṃ phaṭ,” and with the water from all the vases, one should sprinkle the ground in the divisions of the directions of the five maṇḍalas.

original: dri yis nye bar byugs pa phyi rol du me tog gtor ba'i nam mkhar 'dri bar 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor bltas la /
analyzed: dri yis nye bar byugs pa phyi rol du me tog gtor ba'i nam mkhar 'dri bar 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor bltas la /
translated: Having anointed it with scent, having scattered flowers outside, and having seen the maṇḍala in the sky,

original: mchod yon la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas yang dag par mchod cing phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: mchod yon la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas yang dag par mchod cing phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: having made offerings and prostrations with the preliminary water for the feet, and so on,

original: rang de'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas slob ma las thams cad pa'i gzugs su bltas te /
analyzed: rang de'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas slob ma las thams cad pa'i gzugs su bltas te /
translated: one, endowed with the yoga of oneself as the deity, should see the disciple in the form of the karma deity.

original: rang dang de'i g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi mig dag dza: yig las skyes pa'i zla ba @56b dang nyi ma ser po dag bsams la /
analyzed: rang dang de'i g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi mig dag dza: yig las skyes pa'i zla ba @56b dang nyi ma ser po dag bsams la /
translated: One should imagine that one's own left eye and the other's right eye are yellow moons and suns arisen from JA syllables.🔽With vajra steps, holding the thread with one's left fist at the navel, and likewise the disciples, the thread and the JA syllables,

original: rdo rje'i rkang stabs kyis thig skud g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyis bzung ba lte bar 'dzin pa dang de bzhin du slob ma ste thig skud dza: yig rnams dang / dza: yig gsum gyis bskul zhing /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rkang stabs kyis thig skud g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyis bzung ba lte bar 'dzin pa dang de bzhin du slob ma ste thig skud dza: yig rnams dang / dza: yig gsum gyis bskul zhing /
translated: enjoined by the three JA syllables,🔽and the disciples also by the three JA syllables,🔽the three JA syllables are drawn and stand facing each other.🔽One should cast the two Brahma lines in the sky, equal to the navel,🔽facing west, east,

original: slob mas kyang dza: yig gsum gyis dang / dza: yig rnams kyis bkug la mngon du phyogs par gnas pa nub phyogs su gnas pa shar du ba lta ba dang lhor gnas te byang du blta bas tshangs thig gnyis lte ba dang mnyam pa'i bar snang la gdab ste /
analyzed: slob mas kyang dza: yig gsum gyis dang / dza: yig rnams kyis bkug la mngon du phyogs par gnas pa nub phyogs su gnas pa shar du ba lta ba dang lhor gnas te byang du blta bas tshangs thig gnyis lte ba dang mnyam pa'i bar snang la gdab ste /
translated: facing south, and north.

original: aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tra m'a ti kra ma h'um h'um aom sv'a a'a: ha ces pa brjod cing lag pa g-yas pa rdo rje dang bcas pa'i mthe bong dang sor mo dag gis thig skud bzung la se gol gyi sgras bskul bas nam mkhar bzhugs pa'i🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nang du thim par bsgom zhing se gol gyi sgra bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tra m'a ti kra ma h'um h'um aom sv'a a'a: ha ces pa brjod cing lag pa g-yas pa rdo rje dang bcas pa'i mthe bong dang sor mo dag gis thig skud bzung la se gol gyi sgras bskul bas nam mkhar bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nang du thim par bsgom zhing se gol gyi sgra bya'o //
translated: Reciting Oṃ vajra samaya sūtra mati krama hūṃ hūṃ oṃ svāhā aḥ ha, one should hold the thread with the thumb and ring finger of the right hand together with the vajra, and with the sound of snapping one’s fingers, one should imagine that the tathāgatas residing in space dissolve into the thread.

original: de nas bla ma dang slob ma'i g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyis thig skud mnyam par mnan pa'i lag pa dag gis nam mkha' ltar sa la tshangs thig gnyis 'od zer gyi phreng ba ji srid pa dang / me'i zur du gnas pa dang bden bral gyi zur du gnas te /
analyzed: de nas bla ma dang slob ma'i g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyis thig skud mnyam par mnan pa'i lag pa dag gis nam mkha' ltar sa la tshangs thig gnyis 'od zer gyi phreng ba ji srid pa dang / me'i zur du gnas pa dang bden bral gyi zur du gnas te /
translated: Then, with the left fist of the master and the left fist of the disciple holding the thread equally, the two should draw a line from east to west and from north to south with the sound of snapping one’s fingers.

original: rlung dang dbang ldan gyi zur gyi thig gnyis mda' yab kyi thig bar du btab nas me'i zur du gnas te byang du bltas pas shar la rtsa ba'i thig dang rlung du gnas te lhor blta bas nub la'o //
analyzed: rlung dang dbang ldan gyi zur gyi thig gnyis mda' yab kyi thig bar du btab nas me'i zur du gnas te byang du bltas pas shar la rtsa ba'i thig dang rlung du gnas te lhor blta bas nub la'o //
translated: Having been placed in the corner of wind, facing south, they are in the west.

original: de nyid du gnas te shar du blta bas byang la'o //
analyzed: de nyid du gnas te shar du blta bas byang la'o //
translated: Remaining there, facing east, they are in the north.

original: slar yang me'i zur du gnas te nub du blta bas lho ru ste /
analyzed: slar yang me'i zur du gnas te nub du blta bas lho ru ste /
translated: Again, remaining in the corner of fire, facing west, they are in the south.

original: rtsa ba'i thig bzhi 'khor lo'i tshad du gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i thig bzhi 'khor lo'i tshad du gdab par bya'o //
translated: Those four basic lines should be placed in the measure of the wheel.

original: bskor ba ni thams cad du g-yas bskor gyis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du lhag par mos pas so //
analyzed: bskor ba ni thams cad du g-yas bskor gyis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du lhag par mos pas so //
translated: The circling is done by clockwise circling in all cases, with the conviction that all phenomena are equality.

original: nye bar 'dug pa yang slob dpon g-yon pa skyil krung phyed pa byas nas g-yas pa'i zhabs sa la btsugs la nye bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: nye bar 'dug pa yang slob dpon g-yon pa skyil krung phyed pa byas nas g-yas pa'i zhabs sa la btsugs la nye bar 'dug ste /
translated: The teacher should sit down with the left leg in half lotus posture, and the right foot placed on the ground.

original: slob ma de las bzlog pas so //
analyzed: slob ma de las bzlog pas so //
translated: The student should do the opposite.

original: g-yon pa rdo rje khu tshur gyis thig bzung la /
analyzed: g-yon pa rdo rje khu tshur gyis thig bzung la /
translated: The line should be held with the left vajra fist.

original: rgyab nas 'gro zhing nam mkha'i thig lhag par mos pa yang thig gdab pa thams cad la'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyab nas 'gro zhing nam mkha'i thig lhag par mos pa yang thig gdab pa thams cad la'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one should imagine that one is going behind and that the line of the sky is especially long in all the cases of laying out the lines.

original: de nas 'khor lo brgyad chas tshangs pa'i logs gnyis nas cha chung gnyis kyis cha chung bzhi @57a * //
analyzed: de nas 'khor lo brgyad chas tshangs pa'i logs gnyis nas cha chung gnyis kyis cha chung bzhi @57a * //
translated: Then, from the two corners of the Brahma line, one should lay out the eight lines of the wheel, two finger breadths apart.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang thar pa'i sgo'i gegs su gyur pa'i bdud bsal bar bya'o zhes lhag par mos pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang thar pa'i sgo'i gegs su gyur pa'i bdud bsal bar bya'o zhes lhag par mos pa las /
translated: One should imagine that one is dispelling the demons that obstruct the body of the Bhagavat and the door of liberation.

original: h'i: yig gis g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi mig dag zla ba dang nyi mar bskyed nas /
analyzed: h'i: yig gis g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi mig dag zla ba dang nyi mar bskyed nas /
translated: From the syllable hīḥ, one should generate the moon and sun in the left and right eyes.

original: khro bo'i lta stangs kyis kun du blta zhing h'i h'i zhes brjod de phyis la /
analyzed: khro bo'i lta stangs kyis kun du blta zhing h'i h'i zhes brjod de phyis la /
translated: With the gaze of wrath, one should look all around, saying hīḥ hīḥ, and then,

original: rtsa ba las phyir gcig gnyis gcig / gnyis gcig gcig gi bar rnams kyis //
analyzed: rtsa ba las phyir gcig gnyis gcig / gnyis gcig gcig gi bar rnams kyis //
translated: from the root,

original: zur nas thad kar thig drug rnams //
analyzed: zur nas thad kar thig drug rnams //
translated: one should lay out the six lines from the corner, straight across,

original: tshangs pa las rim ring ba las //🔽dang po thig gnyis cha chung gsum //
analyzed: tshangs pa las rim ring ba las // dang po thig gnyis cha chung gsum //
translated: longer than the Brahma line.🔽The first two lines are three finger breadths apart,

original: cha chung gnyis pa'i rtser reg pa'o //
analyzed: cha chung gnyis pa'i rtser reg pa'o //
translated: and the third line touches the tip of the second line.

original: cha chung bdun gyi bar gyis te //
analyzed: cha chung bdun gyi bar gyis te //
translated: The first line is seven small units long.

original: stegs bu'i thig las drang po gsum //
analyzed: stegs bu'i thig las drang po gsum //
translated: Three lines are drawn straight from the platform line.

original: srid du cha chung lnga yin te //
analyzed: srid du cha chung lnga yin te //
translated: They are five small units long.

original: cha chung re re spangs par ro //
analyzed: cha chung re re spangs par ro //
translated: They are separated by one small unit each.

original: thad ka'i thig rtse las phrad pa //
analyzed: thad ka'i thig rtse las phrad pa //
translated: They meet at the tip of the horizontal line.

original: de rnams dang po'i thig yin no //🔽rtsa ba'i rtse las 'thon pa'i thig / cha chung bzhi po cha chung gnyis //
analyzed: de rnams dang po'i thig yin no // rtsa ba'i rtse las 'thon pa'i thig / cha chung bzhi po cha chung gnyis //
translated: Those are the first lines.🔽The lines that emerge from the tip of the base line are four small units long.

original: thad ka steng du'o thad kar de //
analyzed: thad ka steng du'o thad kar de //
translated: Two small units are horizontal and above.

original: cha chung brgyad pas yang dag sbyar //
analyzed: cha chung brgyad pas yang dag sbyar //
translated: They are connected by eight small units.

original: cha chung brgyad pa'i steng du gdung //
analyzed: cha chung brgyad pa'i steng du gdung //
translated: The beam is above the eight small units.

original: cha chung bcu par shes par bya //
analyzed: cha chung bcu par shes par bya //
translated: It should be known to be ten small units.

original: de nas rta babs thad kar ni //
analyzed: de nas rta babs thad kar ni //
translated: Then, directly above the pediment,

original: sgo gsum steng du cha chung bzhi //
analyzed: sgo gsum steng du cha chung bzhi //
translated: there are four small units above the three doors.🔽Wealth, wealth, sun,🔽victorious, wealth, victorious,🔽sun, wealth, sun,

original: nor dang nor dang nyi ma dang // rgyal ba nor dang rgyal pa dang // nyi ma nor dang nyi ma dang / rgyal ba nor rnams rim pa las //
analyzed: nor dang nor dang nyi ma dang // rgyal ba nor dang rgyal pa dang // nyi ma nor dang nyi ma dang / rgyal ba nor rnams rim pa las //
translated: victorious, wealth, in order.

original: sgo yi cha shas steng du der //
analyzed: sgo yi cha shas steng du der //
translated: There, above the part of the door,

original: de ltar snam bu bcu gcig go //
analyzed: de ltar snam bu bcu gcig go //
translated: thus there are eleven layers.

original: tshangs pa'i logs su thad kar ni //🔽phyed bcas cha chung chu gter mthar //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i logs su thad kar ni // phyed bcas cha chung chu gter mthar //
translated: In the middle of the Brahmā line,🔽half a cubit plus one cubit,

original: cha chung phyed bcas gnyis snam bu //
analyzed: cha chung phyed bcas gnyis snam bu //
translated: two cubits plus half a cubit,

original: thig ni phyed bcas gsum gsum mo //
analyzed: thig ni phyed bcas gsum gsum mo //
translated: three cubits plus half a cubit.🔽The second is five cubits,

original: cha chung lnga las gnyis pa dang // gsum pa yang na cha chung gsum //
analyzed: cha chung lnga las gnyis pa dang // gsum pa yang na cha chung gsum //
translated: the third is three cubits,

original: cha chung bzhi las bzhi pa gsum //🔽cha chung phyed bcas gsum la mda' //
analyzed: cha chung bzhi las bzhi pa gsum // cha chung phyed bcas gsum la mda' //
translated: the fourth is four cubits,🔽the fifth is three cubits plus half a cubit.

original: phyed bcas gsum mo gsum las drug / cha chung lnga po de las gsum //
analyzed: phyed bcas gsum mo gsum las drug / cha chung lnga po de las gsum //
translated: The sixth is three cubits plus half a cubit,🔽the seventh is seven cubits,🔽the eighth is eight cubits,

original: cha chung brgyad de cha bdun gcig / mthar ni cha chung drug pa'o//
analyzed: cha chung brgyad de cha bdun gcig / mthar ni cha chung drug pa'o//
translated: and the last is six cubits.🔽One is outside and one inside,

original: phyi rol dang ni nang du gcig / thig skud rtse mor yang dag son //
analyzed: phyi rol dang ni nang du gcig / thig skud rtse mor yang dag son //
translated: reaching the end of the string.

original: slar yang nang du 'khyog po ste //
analyzed: slar yang nang du 'khyog po ste //
translated: Again, inside, it is bent,

original: cha chung phyed mthar yang dag gnas //
analyzed: cha chung phyed mthar yang dag gnas //
translated: reaching the end of half a cubit.

original: rta babs steng du 'khor lo ste //
analyzed: rta babs steng du 'khor lo ste //
translated: Above the pediment, there is a wheel,

original: ri dags brgyan pa cha chung gnyis //🔽'khor lo'i steng du de bzhi na rva //
analyzed: ri dags brgyan pa cha chung gnyis // 'khor lo'i steng du de bzhi na rva //
translated: adorned with deer, two cubits.🔽Above the wheel, there are four half-moons,

original: de bzhin du ni zlum po bzhi //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni zlum po bzhi //
translated: and likewise, four circles.

original: @57b dang po rva rtse nas lhag ma //
analyzed: @57b dang po rva rtse nas lhag ma //
translated: First, the tip of the horn is one cubit.

original: cha chung gcig dang gcig nyid las //
analyzed: cha chung gcig dang gcig nyid las //
translated: From that, one cubit,🔽the circle line is the center of the mandala.

original: zlum po'i thig ni dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar seng ldeng gi phur pa steng dang 'og rtse mo lnga pa gcig pa h'um las skyes pa bltas nas /
analyzed: zlum po'i thig ni dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar seng ldeng gi phur pa steng dang 'og rtse mo lnga pa gcig pa h'um las skyes pa bltas nas /
translated: Having visualized a single five-pointed upper and lower tip stake of acacia wood arisen from hūṃ,

original: phur pa gdab pa'i sngags kyis brgyad dang bcas pa brgya bzlas te /
analyzed: phur pa gdab pa'i sngags kyis brgyad dang bcas pa brgya bzlas te /
translated: recite the mantra of the stake one hundred and eight times.

original: brdung ba'i sngags kyis rdo rje tho bas brdungs la /
analyzed: brdung ba'i sngags kyis rdo rje tho bas brdungs la /
translated: Having struck with the mantra of striking with the vajra hammer,

original: de nas brtags pa'i sngags nyis lnga ba tu byas pa'i thig skud kyis so //
analyzed: de nas brtags pa'i sngags nyis lnga ba tu byas pa'i thig skud kyis so //
translated: then with the mantra of examination, the thread is made into a double strand.

original: de nas thig skud la gtor ma sngon du 'gro bas yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: de nas thig skud la gtor ma sngon du 'gro bas yang dag par mchod de /
translated: Then, having offered a torma to the thread, it is perfectly offered.

original: aom a'a: h'um badzra mu: zhes gshegs la nam mkhar bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ka rnams su bkod nas /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um badzra mu: zhes gshegs la nam mkhar bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ka rnams su bkod nas /
translated: Om āḥ hūṃ vajra muḥ. Having sent it off, having arranged it in the hearts of the tathāgatas residing in space,🔽the five-colored thread should be placed in its proper place.

original: tshon sna lnga'i srad bu gnas ji lta bar gzhag par bya'o zhes pa thig gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: tshon sna lnga'i srad bu gnas ji lta bar gzhag par bya'o zhes pa thig gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of laying the lines.

original: de nas gtor ma phul te /
analyzed: de nas gtor ma phul te /
translated: Then, having offered a torma,

original: 'bras la sogs pa la byas pa /🔽bam lam ram ham yam las skyes pa /
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pa la byas pa / bam lam ram ham yam las skyes pa /
translated: The colors are white, yellow, red, green, and black, which are produced from the seeds vaṃ, laṃ, raṃ, haṃ, and yaṃ.

original: dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu dang nag po'i tshon ji lta ba bzhin rang gi sa bon las grub pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams la thig 'dus byas par gsungs pa'i cho gas spyan drangs te bcug pa'i ye
analyzed: dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu dang nag po'i tshon ji lta ba bzhin rang gi sa bon las grub pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams la thig 'dus byas par gsungs pa'i cho gas spyan drangs te bcug pa'i ye
translated: They are the nature of Vairocana and so on, produced from their respective seeds.🔽The colors of pristine consciousness and the colors of the lines become of one taste.

original: shes kyi tshon dang ro gcig tu gyur cing rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sa bon bzlas pa rnams la /
analyzed: shes kyi tshon dang ro gcig tu gyur cing rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sa bon bzlas pa rnams la /
translated: The seeds of Vairocana and so on are recited.

original: aom badzra tsi tra sa ma ya h'um zhes pa brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas /
analyzed: aom badzra tsi tra sa ma ya h'um zhes pa brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas /
translated: Recite oṃ vajra citra samaya hūṃ one hundred and eight times.

original: sngar bzhin 'bar ba'i lta stangs kyis gzi brjid bskyed de so so la h'um yig bkod la /
analyzed: sngar bzhin 'bar ba'i lta stangs kyis gzi brjid bskyed de so so la h'um yig bkod la /
translated: As before, generate brilliance with the gaze of blazing and place the syllable hūṃ on each.

original: rdul tshon mang po'i bden pa gang gis sems can dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems can la chags pa dang / rjes su chags pa'i bden pa des rdul tshon 'bar bar gyur cig ces pa den pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis rab tu sbar te /
analyzed: rdul tshon mang po'i bden pa gang gis sems can dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems can la chags pa dang / rjes su chags pa'i bden pa des rdul tshon 'bar bar gyur cig ces pa den pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis rab tu sbar te /
translated: Having made this truth consecration, one should burn the colored powders with the fire.

original: me tog la sogs pas mngon par mchod la snod gsar par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pas mngon par mchod la snod gsar par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having made offerings with flowers and so forth, one should place them in a new vessel.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar gnas pa'i phur pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i h'um yig bzhi'i sngags kyis bton la /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar gnas pa'i phur pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i h'um yig bzhi'i sngags kyis bton la /
translated: Then, one should extract the dagger that is located in the center of the mandala with the mantra of the four HŪṂ syllables that will be explained.

original: rang gi lag pa'i rdo rje la blos nang du bsgoms nas phur bu'i khung bu rdul tshon lnga rnams kyis kun du bkang zhing mnyam par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi lag pa'i rdo rje la blos nang du bsgoms nas phur bu'i khung bu rdul tshon lnga rnams kyis kun du bkang zhing mnyam par bya ste /
translated: Having mentally meditated on the vajra in one's hand, one should fill the hole of the dagger completely with the five colored powders and make them even.

original: dril bu'i sgra dang rdo rje'i glu rnams kyis mtshan ma ngan pa bsal la //
analyzed: dril bu'i sgra dang rdo rje'i glu rnams kyis mtshan ma ngan pa bsal la //
translated: Having removed the bad signs with the sound of the bell and the vajra song,

original: @58a * // 'di ni chos dbyings dag pa ste //
analyzed: @58a * // 'di ni chos dbyings dag pa ste //
translated: this is the pure realm of phenomena,

original: sems can khams ni rab grol byed //
analyzed: sems can khams ni rab grol byed //
translated: which liberates the realm of sentient beings.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rgyal po rang //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rgyal po rang //
translated: One is the king of vajra holders.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas //
translated: The abode of all the tathagatas,

original: nyes pa kun las rnam grol ba //
analyzed: nyes pa kun las rnam grol ba //
translated: completely free from all faults,

original: 'khor lo'i nang du yang dag gnas //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i nang du yang dag gnas //
translated: resides in the center of the mandala.

original: zhes chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag par lhag par mos shing /
analyzed: zhes chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag par lhag par mos shing /
translated: Thus, with the conviction that the realm of phenomena is pure,

original: dang por dkyil 'khor gyi nang du 'dug ste /
analyzed: dang por dkyil 'khor gyi nang du 'dug ste /
translated: first one should sit inside the mandala.

original: lag pa g-yas pa rdo rje dang bcas pa g-yon pa rdo rje khu tshur /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa rdo rje dang bcas pa g-yon pa rdo rje khu tshur /
translated: The right hand is held with a vajra, the left hand is a vajra fist.

original: aom badzra tsi tra sa ma ya h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra tsi tra sa ma ya h'um /
translated: Om vajra citra samaya hum.

original: zhes brjod cing kha shar du bltas la dbang ldan nas brtsams la g-yas skor du kha dog lnga'i tshon cung zad tsam gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod cing kha shar du bltas la dbang ldan nas brtsams la g-yas skor du kha dog lnga'i tshon cung zad tsam gdab par bya'o //
translated: Reciting this, facing east, beginning from the northeast, one should scatter a little bit of the five-colored chalk in a clockwise direction.

original: phyi nas gzhan nam rang gis kyang zhes pa ji ltar bde bar ro //
analyzed: phyi nas gzhan nam rang gis kyang zhes pa ji ltar bde bar ro //
translated: Later, either another person or oneself should do it as is convenient.

original: re kh'a rnams kyang sboms pa dang phra ba dang chad pa dang 'khyog pa dang phan tshun 'dres pa ma yin pa ste thams cad sgo'i nyi shu cha'o //
analyzed: re kh'a rnams kyang sboms pa dang phra ba dang chad pa dang 'khyog pa dang phan tshun 'dres pa ma yin pa ste thams cad sgo'i nyi shu cha'o //
translated: The lines should not be thick or thin, broken or crooked, or mixed with each other. All of them are one-twentieth of the door.

original: 'jug pa dang 'thon pa la yang rdul tshon gyi re kh'a yid kyis nam mkhar bteg nas /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang 'thon pa la yang rdul tshon gyi re kh'a yid kyis nam mkhar bteg nas /
translated: Also, when entering and exiting, one should mentally lift the chalk line of the colored particles into the sky.

original: aom badzra be g'a kra ma h'um zhes pa'i thig la sogs pa 'gom pa'i nyes pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra be g'a kra ma h'um zhes pa'i thig la sogs pa 'gom pa'i nyes pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra Oṃ vajra-vegākrama hūṃ.

original: de la thog mar sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar sna tshogs chu skyes kyi ze'u 'brur nyi ma ser po la /
analyzed: de la thog mar sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar sna tshogs chu skyes kyi ze'u 'brur nyi ma ser po la /
translated: In the center of a variegated vajra, on the anthers of a variegated lotus, on a yellow sun,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rdo rje drag po rtse lnga pa sngon po'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rdo rje drag po rtse lnga pa sngon po'o //
translated: is the Bhagavān’s blue, five-pointed vajra.

original: shar dang byang dang nub dang lho'i 'dab ma dmar po rnams la mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams kyi gri gug go //
analyzed: shar dang byang dang nub dang lho'i 'dab ma dmar po rnams la mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams kyi gri gug go //
translated: On the red petals in the east, north, west, and south are the flaying knives of dakini and so on.

original: me dang bden bral la sogs pa phyogs bral gyi 'dab ma ser po dang / ljang gu dang ser po dang nag po char sprin lta bu rnams so //
analyzed: me dang bden bral la sogs pa phyogs bral gyi 'dab ma ser po dang / ljang gu dang ser po dang nag po char sprin lta bu rnams so //
translated: The yellow, green, yellow, and black-as-a-rain-cloud petals in the intermediate directions of fire, the direction of Brahmā, and so on are the colors of Khaṇḍarohā and so on.

original: 'dab ma'i phyi rol rtsa ba'i thig gi nang du g-yon skor gyis shar la sogs pa'i sa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang don yod grub pa dang snang ba mtha' yas dang rin chen 'byung ldan gyi kha dog go //
analyzed: 'dab ma'i phyi rol rtsa ba'i thig gi nang du g-yon skor gyis shar la sogs pa'i sa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang don yod grub pa dang snang ba mtha' yas dang rin chen 'byung ldan gyi kha dog go //
translated: Outside the petals, within the basic lines, the colors of the directions beginning with the east are those of Vairochana, Amoghasiddhi, Amitabha, and Ratnasambhava, respectively.

original: shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams su khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams dang / me la sogs pa'i zur rnams su gshin rje brtan ma la sogs pa rnams kyi g-yon dang cig shos kyis bskor bas sna tshogs chu skyes dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i gri gug go //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams su khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams dang / me la sogs pa'i zur rnams su gshin rje brtan ma la sogs pa rnams kyi g-yon dang cig shos kyis bskor bas sna tshogs chu skyes dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i gri gug go //
translated: At the gates beginning with the east are the goddesses Kakasya and so forth, and at the corners beginning with the southeast are the goddesses Yamantaka and so forth, standing on variegated lotuses and moons, with curved knives in their left and right hands, respectively.

original: sgo'i logs gnyis su bum pa brgyad do //
analyzed: sgo'i logs gnyis su bum pa brgyad do //
translated: On the two sides of the gates are eight vases.

original: rtsa ba'i thig las phyi rol rdul tshon gyi snam bu las so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i thig las phyi rol rdul tshon gyi snam bu las so //
translated: They are outside the basic lines, on the colored-powder platform.

original: nang @58b nas brtsams te nag po dang ljang khu dang dmar po dang ser po dang dkar po'i re kh'a rnams so //
analyzed: nang @58b nas brtsams te nag po dang ljang khu dang dmar po dang ser po dang dkar po'i re kh'a rnams so //
translated: Beginning from the inside, the lines are black, green, red, yellow, and white.

original: de'i phyi rol gyi stegs bu ji ltar mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi stegs bu ji ltar mdzes pa'o //
translated: Outside of that, the platform is as beautiful as possible.

original: sgo dang sgo khyud kyi mtshams su zla ba'i cha la gnas pa'i rin po che rnams dang steng du rdo rje phyed po rnams so //
analyzed: sgo dang sgo khyud kyi mtshams su zla ba'i cha la gnas pa'i rin po che rnams dang steng du rdo rje phyed po rnams so //
translated: At the juncture of the door and door frame, there are jewels located on moon parts and above them are half-vajras.

original: rta babs kyi kyog po'i nang gi nam mkha' dang ka ba rnams kyang rang rang gi phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i kha dog ste /
analyzed: rta babs kyi kyog po'i nang gi nam mkha' dang ka ba rnams kyang rang rang gi phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i kha dog ste /
translated: The space and pillars inside the archways are also the colors of the respective tathāgatas of the directions.

original: gru bzhi pa'i stegs bur gnas pa'i bum pa la gnas pa rtsa ba dang rtse mor nor bu bcings pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa'i stegs bur gnas pa'i bum pa la gnas pa rtsa ba dang rtse mor nor bu bcings pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The vases located on the platforms in the corners have bases and tips bound with jewels.

original: dar dpyang gi snam bu la glang po che'i steng du seng ge'i kha nas 'phyang ba'i rin po che'i do shal lo //
analyzed: dar dpyang gi snam bu la glang po che'i steng du seng ge'i kha nas 'phyang ba'i rin po che'i do shal lo //
translated: On the hanging silk platforms, there are jewel necklaces hanging from the mouths of lions on elephants.

original: rin chen snam bu la zur du zur gsum dang / gru bzhi dang thig le dang / zlum po rnams rim pas rin po ches bcings pa'o //
analyzed: rin chen snam bu la zur du zur gsum dang / gru bzhi dang thig le dang / zlum po rnams rim pas rin po ches bcings pa'o //
translated: On the jewel platforms, there are triangles, squares, bindus, and circles bound with jewels in the corners.

original: dra ba'i snam bu la gser gyi rked dkris bzhi la btags pa chu srin gyi kha nas byung ba'i srad bu dmar pos brgyus pa'i mu tig gi dra ba ste /
analyzed: dra ba'i snam bu la gser gyi rked dkris bzhi la btags pa chu srin gyi kha nas byung ba'i srad bu dmar pos brgyus pa'i mu tig gi dra ba ste /
translated: On the net cloth, there are four golden belts, and from the mouth of a makara, there is a red string, which is strung through a pearl net.

original: nor bu'i chun po gser gyis bcings pa gnyis dbus su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i chun po gser gyis bcings pa gnyis dbus su gnas pa'o //
translated: There are two tassels of jewels bound with gold, which are located in the center.

original: dra ba'i logs dag tu gser gyis bcings pa'i nor bu sbom pos rtse mo mdzes pa'i dra ba phyed pa'o //
analyzed: dra ba'i logs dag tu gser gyis bcings pa'i nor bu sbom pos rtse mo mdzes pa'i dra ba phyed pa'o //
translated: On the sides of the net, there are half-nets, which are beautified with the tips of thick jewels bound with gold.

original: 'ga' zhig tu dril bu'i nang du rnga yab dang cung zad thung ba'i rin po che'i phreng bas logs gnyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu dril bu'i nang du rnga yab dang cung zad thung ba'i rin po che'i phreng bas logs gnyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: In some cases, inside the bells, there are yak-tail whisks, and the sides are adorned with short jewel garlands.

original: 'ga' zhig tu me tog gi phreng bas logs gnyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu me tog gi phreng bas logs gnyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: In some cases, the sides are adorned with flower garlands.

original: dra ba'i nang du padma dang zla ba'i cha rdo rje phyed pas mtshan pa'i rin po che'o //
analyzed: dra ba'i nang du padma dang zla ba'i cha rdo rje phyed pas mtshan pa'i rin po che'o //
translated: Inside the net, there is a part of a lotus and moon, which is marked with a half-vajra jewel.

original: 'ga' zhig tu nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In some cases, there is a sun maṇḍala.

original: 'ga' zhig tu padma la gnas pa'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu padma la gnas pa'i rdo rje'o //
translated: In some cases, there is a vajra on a lotus.

original: ba ku li rnams dkar po'o //
analyzed: ba ku li rnams dkar po'o //
translated: The bakulas are white.

original: mda' yab rnams ni dkar po padma'i 'dab ma phyed pa'i dbyibs so //
analyzed: mda' yab rnams ni dkar po padma'i 'dab ma phyed pa'i dbyibs so //
translated: The parapets are white, shaped like half lotus petals.

original: sgo logs kyi steng du gdung gi snam bu la rin po che sna tshogs pa'i pa tra dang ldan pa'i gdung ngo //
analyzed: sgo logs kyi steng du gdung gi snam bu la rin po che sna tshogs pa'i pa tra dang ldan pa'i gdung ngo //
translated: Above the back of the gate, on the beam ledge, there is a beam with a pattern of various jewels.

original: de'i steng du bar snang gi snam bu sngon po'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du bar snang gi snam bu sngon po'o //
translated: Above that is the blue sky ledge.

original: mnga' yab rnams la phyogs brgyad du gser la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i bum pa la gnas pa'i rgyal mtshan dang ba dan rnams te /
analyzed: mnga' yab rnams la phyogs brgyad du gser la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i bum pa la gnas pa'i rgyal mtshan dang ba dan rnams te /
translated: On the parapets, in the eight directions, there are victory banners and pennants, which are placed on vases of gold and so forth.

original: zla ba tshes pa dang rin po che dang rdo rje dang ldan pa /🔽rin po che'i dbyug pa'i rtse mor btags pa'i dril bu las 'phyang ba'i lce gcig pa dang gnyis pa'i rtse mor ri dags kyi rgyal po @59a * //
analyzed: zla ba tshes pa dang rin po che dang rdo rje dang ldan pa / rin po che'i dbyug pa'i rtse mor btags pa'i dril bu las 'phyang ba'i lce gcig pa dang gnyis pa'i rtse mor ri dags kyi rgyal po @59a * //
translated: They are adorned with crescents, jewels, and vajras.

original: dang dang pa'i rgyal po dang rma bya dang nya dang chu srin gyis mtshan pa rnams so //
analyzed: dang dang pa'i rgyal po dang rma bya dang nya dang chu srin gyis mtshan pa rnams so //
translated: One- and two-pointed tongues hang from the top of jeweled staffs and bells. The tips are marked with a lion, elephant, peacock, fish, and makara.

original: de bzhin du ba dan yang ste mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ba dan yang ste mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: The pennants are also like that, but without the marks.

original: zur rnams su gdugs dag go //
analyzed: zur rnams su gdugs dag go //
translated: At the corners, parasols.

original: rta babs kyi snam bu bcu gcig po rnams la ka ba'i rtse mo nas brtsams te rim pas ba ku li dang rin po che dang rta rmig dang gser dang chu srin dang yang gser dang rta rmig dang rin po che dang rta rmig dang gser dang mda'
analyzed: rta babs kyi snam bu bcu gcig po rnams la ka ba'i rtse mo nas brtsams te rim pas ba ku li dang rin po che dang rta rmig dang gser dang chu srin dang yang gser dang rta rmig dang rin po che dang rta rmig dang gser dang mda'
translated: On the eleven terraces of the gateways, beginning from the top of the pillars, in order, there are: a garland of flowers, jewels, horse-hoof [decorations], gold, sea monsters, again gold, horse-hoof [decorations], jewels, horse-hoof [decorations], gold, and arrows.

original: yab rnams so //
analyzed: yab rnams so //
translated: These are the parapets.

original: mda' yab kyi snam bu la gnas pa'i padma dang zla ba'i gdan gyi steng du gser gyi 'khor lo rnams so //
analyzed: mda' yab kyi snam bu la gnas pa'i padma dang zla ba'i gdan gyi steng du gser gyi 'khor lo rnams so //
translated: On the terrace of the parapets, on the seats of lotuses and moons, there are golden wheels.

original: 'khor lo'i logs gnyis su gser gyi rang bzhin ri dags dang ri dags mo dag 'khor lo la mngon du phyogs pa mgrin ba stod de nyal ba ji ltar mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i logs gnyis su gser gyi rang bzhin ri dags dang ri dags mo dag 'khor lo la mngon du phyogs pa mgrin ba stod de nyal ba ji ltar mdzes pa'o //
translated: On both sides of the wheels, golden deer and does, facing the wheels, lie down with their necks raised, as is beautiful.

original: 'khor lo'i steng du sna tshogs rdo rje'i rva cha chung gnyis pa rang gi phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i kha dog go //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i steng du sna tshogs rdo rje'i rva cha chung gnyis pa rang gi phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i kha dog go //
translated: Above the wheels, there are half-small-part vajra-splinters of a variegated vajra, the colors of the respective directions of the Tathagatas.

original: rta babs kyi logs gnyis su gnas pa'i rva kyog po ste de las tshu rol du mda' yab rnams la ri dags mo'i mjug ma'i logs su gnas pa'i spre'us yu ba nas 'dzin pa'i gdugs rnams te ji ltar mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: rta babs kyi logs gnyis su gnas pa'i rva kyog po ste de las tshu rol du mda' yab rnams la ri dags mo'i mjug ma'i logs su gnas pa'i spre'us yu ba nas 'dzin pa'i gdugs rnams te ji ltar mdzes pa'o //
translated: On the two sides of the archways, there are two horns, curved, and on the parapets at the two ends of the horns, there are umbrellas held by monkeys on the backs of female deer.

original: gzhal yas khang gi zur dang nye ba rnams su dpag bsam gyi shing rnams so //
analyzed: gzhal yas khang gi zur dang nye ba rnams su dpag bsam gyi shing rnams so //
translated: In the corners and near the corners of the celestial mansion, there are wish-fulfilling trees.

original: sna tshogs chu skyes kyi ze'u 'bru ljang gu ge sar ser po 'dab ma rnams kha dog sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs chu skyes kyi ze'u 'bru ljang gu ge sar ser po 'dab ma rnams kha dog sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: The lotus is variegated, with green anthers and yellow filaments, and the petals are of various colors.

original: de'i sa ni dkar dmar ro //
analyzed: de'i sa ni dkar dmar ro //
translated: Its ground is red and white.

original: rdo rje phreng pa'i re kh'a nag po ste /
analyzed: rdo rje phreng pa'i re kh'a nag po ste /
translated: The vajra garland is black.

original: rtse mo gsum pa 'am lnga pa'i rdo rje rnams so //
analyzed: rtse mo gsum pa 'am lnga pa'i rdo rje rnams so //
translated: The vajras have three or five points.

original: de yi sa ni ji ltar mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: de yi sa ni ji ltar mdzes pa'o //
translated: Their ground is as beautiful as possible.

original: 'od zer ni kha dog lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer ni kha dog lnga pa'o //
translated: The light rays are five-colored.

original: de'i phyi rol du dur khrod rnams bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du dur khrod rnams bri bar bya'o //
translated: Outside of that, one should draw the charnel grounds.

original: skal pa dang mi ldan pa 'dus pa med na ste gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: skal pa dang mi ldan pa 'dus pa med na ste gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: If there is no gathering of the unworthy, not otherwise.

original: de yang rgyud kho nar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyud kho nar shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be known only from the tantra.

original: de nas las thams cad dang h'um yig gis kyang bzlas pa'i dri chu bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pas dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du byugs nas de bzlas shing chu yis 'khor lo la bsang gtor byas te rdul tshon lhag ma yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: de nas las thams cad dang h'um yig gis kyang bzlas pa'i dri chu bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pas dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du byugs nas de bzlas shing chu yis 'khor lo la bsang gtor byas te rdul tshon lhag ma yang dag par mchod la /
translated: Then, having anointed the outside of the maṇḍala with the water for bathing, which is the mantra recitation together with the five elixirs, with the mantra of all activities and hūṃ, having sprinkled the wheel with that water, and having made a perfect offering to the remaining colored powder,🔽one should dismiss the gnosis colored powder with oṃ āḥ hūṃ vajra muḥ, and one should place the colored powder in a vessel in a secluded place.

original: aom a'a: h'um badzra mu: zhes ye shes kyi rdul tshon gshegs shing snod na gnas pa rnams dben par gzhag par bya'o zhes pa rdul tshon gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um badzra mu: zhes ye shes kyi rdul tshon gshegs shing snod na gnas pa rnams dben par gzhag par bya'o zhes pa rdul tshon gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the procedure for laying out the colored powder.

original: de nas sngar lhag par @59b gnas pa'i rnam rgyal gyi bum pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la g-yas skor byas nas /
analyzed: de nas sngar lhag par @59b gnas pa'i rnam rgyal gyi bum pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la g-yas skor byas nas /
translated: Then, having circumambulated the maṇḍala wheel clockwise with the victory vase that was previously set up,

original: 'od zer phreng ba'i phyi rol gyi sa la ste /
analyzed: 'od zer phreng ba'i phyi rol gyi sa la ste /
translated: one should place it outside the garland of light rays on the ground,

original: dur khrod yod na de'i phyi rol du dkyil 'khor gyi shar sgo'i thad ka las cung zad g-yas su gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dur khrod yod na de'i phyi rol du dkyil 'khor gyi shar sgo'i thad ka las cung zad g-yas su gzhag par bya'o //
translated: or, if there is a charnel ground, outside of that, slightly to the right of the eastern gate of the maṇḍala.

original: g-yon du mkha' 'gro ma'i dang las thams cad pa ste g-yas skor du'o //
analyzed: g-yon du mkha' 'gro ma'i dang las thams cad pa ste g-yas skor du'o //
translated: On the left, the activity dakini from the syllable tam.

original: g-yas su khva gdong ma yi'o //
analyzed: g-yas su khva gdong ma yi'o //
translated: On the right, the crow-faced one.

original: byad sgo'i g-yon du l'a ma'i dang g-yas su 'ug gdong ma yi'o //🔽nub sgo'i g-yon du dum skyes ma'i dang g-yas su khyi gdong ma yi'o //
analyzed: byad sgo'i g-yon du l'a ma'i dang g-yas su 'ug gdong ma yi'o // nub sgo'i g-yon du dum skyes ma'i dang g-yas su khyi gdong ma yi'o //
translated: On the left of the southern door, the Lāmā from the syllable kham. On the right, the owl-faced one.🔽On the left of the western door, the Khaṇḍarohā from the syllable gham. On the right, the dog-faced one.

original: lho sgo'i g-yon du gzugs can ma'i dang g-yas su phag gdong ma yi'o //
analyzed: lho sgo'i g-yon du gzugs can ma'i dang g-yas su phag gdong ma yi'o //
translated: On the left of the southern door, the Rūpiṇī from the syllable cham. On the right, the pig-faced one.

original: me la sogs pa'i mtshams rnams su gshin rje brtan ma la sogs pa'i bum pa rnams so //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i mtshams rnams su gshin rje brtan ma la sogs pa'i bum pa rnams so //
translated: In the intermediate directions beginning with the southeast, the vases of Yamadhātṛ and so forth.

original: zur gyi bum pa bzhi rnams la mda' bya rgod ma bzhi ste /
analyzed: zur gyi bum pa bzhi rnams la mda' bya rgod ma bzhi ste /
translated: In the four corner vases, the four vulture-headed arrows.

original: aom badzra yaksha h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyis gzhag par bya'o zhes pa bum pa dgod pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: aom badzra yaksha h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyis gzhag par bya'o zhes pa bum pa dgod pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: They should be placed with the mantra Oṃ vajra yakṣa hūṃ. This is the rite of placing the vases.

original: de'i rjes la bla re dang gdugs dang rnga yab la sogs pa rnams h'um yig gis bsngags te aom badzra sba ra na kham zhes pa'i sngags kyis spros la de rnams kyis ji ltar nus pa dang ji ltar mdzes pa bzhin mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes la bla re dang gdugs dang rnga yab la sogs pa rnams h'um yig gis bsngags te aom badzra sba ra na kham zhes pa'i sngags kyis spros la de rnams kyis ji ltar nus pa dang ji ltar mdzes pa bzhin mchod pa byas nas /
translated: Having made offerings with those to the best of one’s ability and as beautifully as possible,

original: slob dpon khrus la sogs pa byas te las thams cad pa bzlas pa'i chus dkyil 'khor la bsang gtor byas shing /
analyzed: slob dpon khrus la sogs pa byas te las thams cad pa bzlas pa'i chus dkyil 'khor la bsang gtor byas shing /
translated: the master should perform the ablutions and so on, sprinkle the maṇḍala with water enchanted with the mantra of all activities,🔽and guard it with the same mantra.

original: de nyid kyis bsrungs la dkyil 'khor gyi shar du zhal nub tu phyogs par 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis bsrungs la dkyil 'khor gyi shar du zhal nub tu phyogs par 'dug ste /
translated: Sitting to the east of the maṇḍala facing west,

original: rdo rje 'dril bu dang bcas pas 'khor lo'i dbang phyug gi bdag nyid can bris pa'i dkyil 'khor skad cig la stong par byas nas /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dril bu dang bcas pas 'khor lo'i dbang phyug gi bdag nyid can bris pa'i dkyil 'khor skad cig la stong par byas nas /
translated: together with the vajra and the bell, one should instantly visualize the maṇḍala, which is the nature of the lord of the wheel, as empty.

original: srung ba'i 'khor lo dang bgegs la phur bu gdab pa la sogs pa cho ga thams cad tshang bar bsgoms la /
analyzed: srung ba'i 'khor lo dang bgegs la phur bu gdab pa la sogs pa cho ga thams cad tshang bar bsgoms la /
translated: Having meditated on the complete rite, such as the protection wheel and the implantation of the dagger into the obstructors,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin du nges par byas te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin du nges par byas te /
translated: one should ascertain the nature of the maṇḍala.

original: rab tu bsgrubs pa phyi'i phyag rgya'am ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang lhan cig rab tu dga' ba'i sgras spyan drangs pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo la mchod yon la sogs pas yang dag par mchod nas nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: rab tu bsgrubs pa phyi'i phyag rgya'am ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang lhan cig rab tu dga' ba'i sgras spyan drangs pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo la mchod yon la sogs pas yang dag par mchod nas nang du bcug ste /
translated: Having invited the wheel of exalted wisdom with the sound of great joy, having made offerings with water for drinking and so forth, having caused them to enter inside,

original: chags pa chen pos zhu bar gyur pa rdo rje'i lam nas padmar phyung ba /
analyzed: chags pa chen pos zhu bar gyur pa rdo rje'i lam nas padmar phyung ba /
translated: having caused them to melt through great passion, having caused them to emerge from the lotus through the path of the vajra,

original: ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i bdag nyid can spros nas /
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i bdag nyid can spros nas /
translated: having emanated the wheel of exalted wisdom,

original: dam tshig gi 'khor lo la gnas ji lta bar rab tu bzhugs @60a * //
analyzed: dam tshig gi 'khor lo la gnas ji lta bar rab tu bzhugs @60a * //
translated: having caused them to abide in the place of the commitment wheel just as before,

original: par rnam par bsam zhing /
analyzed: par rnam par bsam zhing /
translated: having imagined that,

original: mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i de ma thag rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis spyan drangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dbang bskur ba dang rgyas gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i de ma thag rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis spyan drangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dbang bskur ba dang rgyas gdab par bya'o //
translated: immediately after the consecration of the eyes and so forth, having empowered the Tathagatas invited by the light rays of the seed syllable in one's heart, one should confer initiation and seal them.

original: de nas spros pa'i lha mo rnams kyis mchod nas /
analyzed: de nas spros pa'i lha mo rnams kyis mchod nas /
translated: Then, having made offerings with the emanated goddesses,

original: sh'i ta li ka'i gos zung la sogs pa dang / bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa'i nus pa ji lta bas rab tu mchod la /
analyzed: sh'i ta li ka'i gos zung la sogs pa dang / bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa'i nus pa ji lta bas rab tu mchod la /
translated: One should worship with the pair of garments of human skin and so forth, and with food, drink, and so forth, according to one's ability.

original: phyi rol gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis gar la sogs pas mchod de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis gar la sogs pas mchod de /
translated: The external yoginis worship with dance and so forth.

original: dril bu dkrol zhing rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags kyis bstod nas rang gi shes rab ma'i me tog dang byang chub kyi sems padma'i snod du bzhag la bdud rtsir byas te dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dril bu dkrol zhing rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags kyis bstod nas rang gi shes rab ma'i me tog dang byang chub kyi sems padma'i snod du bzhag la bdud rtsir byas te dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Having rung the bell and praised with the eight-line praise, one should place the flower of one's wisdom and the bodhicitta in the lotus vessel and offer it as nectar.

original: bdud rtsi de myangs pas tshim par gyur nas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du lhag par mos pa bya zhing /
analyzed: bdud rtsi de myangs pas tshim par gyur nas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du lhag par mos pa bya zhing /
translated: Having tasted that nectar and become satisfied, one should imagine that one has become the nature of great bliss.

original: 'khor lo'i dbang phyug gi sngags brgya rtsa brgyad dang / gzhan rnams kyi nyi shu rtsa re re dang yi ge brgya ba yang bzlas te /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dbang phyug gi sngags brgya rtsa brgyad dang / gzhan rnams kyi nyi shu rtsa re re dang yi ge brgya ba yang bzlas te /
translated: One should recite the mantra of Cakrasaṃvara one hundred and eight times, each of the others twenty times, and also the one-hundred-syllable mantra.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gtor ma'i le'u'i cho gas 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gtor ma'i le'u'i cho gas 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer a bali to all the spirits according to the rite of the Bali Chapter that will be explained.

original: de'i rjes la lag pa g-yas pa gan rkyal du byas la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la lag pa g-yas pa gan rkyal du byas la /
translated: Then, with the right hand lying flat,

original: gung mo dang ming med cung zad bkug pa kha'i mngon du byas te /
analyzed: gung mo dang ming med cung zad bkug pa kha'i mngon du byas te /
translated: bend the middle finger and the ring finger slightly, and place it in front of the mouth.

original: de'i gru mo pus mo'i bar du byas la /
analyzed: de'i gru mo pus mo'i bar du byas la /
translated: Place the elbow between the knees,

original: tsog pur 'dug cing mi smra bar lag pa'i rtse mo zhal la mang du byab cing /
analyzed: tsog pur 'dug cing mi smra bar lag pa'i rtse mo zhal la mang du byab cing /
translated: sit with the knees drawn up to the chest, and without speaking, wipe the tip of the hand on the mouth many times.

original: lan gsum rna ba dag dang mig dag dang sna ngang kha dang lag pa dang lte ba dang spyi bor yang reg par bya'o zhes pa nye reg bya ba'o//
analyzed: lan gsum rna ba dag dang mig dag dang sna ngang kha dang lag pa dang lte ba dang spyi bor yang reg par bya'o zhes pa nye reg bya ba'o//
translated: Touch the ears, eyes, nose, mouth, hands, navel, and head three times.

original: de nas 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas me tog gi phreng ba bzung ste /
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas me tog gi phreng ba bzung ste /
translated: Then, holding a flower garland, endowed with the yoga of total victory over the three worlds,

original: aom sumbha zhes pa la sogs pa zhal bzhi pa'i sngags brjod cing /
analyzed: aom sumbha zhes pa la sogs pa zhal bzhi pa'i sngags brjod cing /
translated: recite the mantra of the four faces, “Oṃ suṃbha” and so on.

original: rdo rje'i shugs kyis dkyil 'khor du zhugs nas rdo rje gsor zhing dril bu dkrol te /🔽aom h'um phat /🔽aom h'um a'a: phat /
analyzed: rdo rje'i shugs kyis dkyil 'khor du zhugs nas rdo rje gsor zhing dril bu dkrol te / aom h'um phat / aom h'um a'a: phat /
translated: Enter the maṇḍala with the speed of a vajra, wave the vajra, and ring the bell.🔽Oṃ hūṃ phaṭ.🔽Oṃ hūṃ āḥ phaṭ.

original: aom h'um a'a: phat /
analyzed: aom h'um a'a: phat /
translated: Oṃ hūṃ āḥ phaṭ.

original: aom h'um ha na m'a ra ya dusht'ana gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya a'a: a'a: h'um hr'i: phat /
analyzed: aom h'um ha na m'a ra ya dusht'ana gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya a'a: a'a: h'um hr'i: phat /
translated: oṃ hūṃ hana māraya duṣṭān ghaṭaya ghaṭaya āḥ āḥ hūṃ hriḥ phaṭ.

original: ces pa'i sngags bzhi rim pas shar dang lho la sogs pa'i sgo'i slob dpon rnams kyis brjod pa dang lhan cig rdo rje'i rkang stabs kyis g-yas skor gsum byas nas /
analyzed: ces pa'i sngags bzhi rim pas shar dang lho la sogs pa'i sgo'i slob dpon rnams kyis brjod pa dang lhan cig rdo rje'i rkang stabs kyis g-yas skor gsum byas nas /
translated: The four mantras are recited in sequence by the masters of the eastern, southern, and other gates, and at the same time one circles to the right three times with the vajra gait.

original: bcom ldan @60b 'das la phreng ba phul la nub dang byang la sogs pa'i sgor gnas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan @60b 'das la phreng ba phul la nub dang byang la sogs pa'i sgor gnas te /
translated: Offer the garland to the Bhagavat and remain at the western, northern, and other gates.

original: shar dang lho la sogs pa'i sgor aom badzra autbha ta ya sa ma ya pra be sha ya h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyis phye bar bltas nas /
analyzed: shar dang lho la sogs pa'i sgor aom badzra autbha ta ya sa ma ya pra be sha ya h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyis phye bar bltas nas /
translated: At the eastern, southern, and other gates, look at the opening with the mantra oṃ vajroṣṇīṣa samanta­prabha jñāna-cakṣur avai loka-prabhāvaṇa hūṃ.

original: aom sa ma yam pra bi sh'a ya mi zhes brjod de /
analyzed: aom sa ma yam pra bi sh'a ya mi zhes brjod de /

original: slar gar byed cing phreng ba blangs la rang gi spyi bor bcings nas 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: slar gar byed cing phreng ba blangs la rang gi spyi bor bcings nas 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Again dance, take up the garland, bind it to one’s head, and offer prostrations to the wheel.

original: sems can thams cad la dngos grub rab tu stsal du gsol zhes gsol ba gdab cing bsam gtan dang bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dngos grub rab tu stsal du gsol zhes gsol ba gdab cing bsam gtan dang bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One should make the request, Please grant the supreme spiritual power to all sentient beings, and perform the meditation and recitation.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams dang phyogs kyi bdag po rnams la ji ltar nus pa'i ba dan yang dbul bar bya'o zhes pa dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams dang phyogs kyi bdag po rnams la ji ltar nus pa'i ba dan yang dbul bar bya'o zhes pa dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: One should also offer banners to the deities of the maṇḍala and the lords of the directions, according to one's ability. This is the ritual of accomplishing the maṇḍala.

analyzed: de ltar rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du rab tu gnas pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / spyin sreg la sogs pa dang / rang la dbang bskur ba yang byas nas /
translated: Having thus performed the consecration in the perfect maṇḍala, the empowerment, the burnt offerings, and so forth, and also the self-empowerment,

analyzed: sngon du tshogs kyi 'khor lo bya ste dkyil 'khor gshegs par bya'o //

analyzed: de la gshegs pa ni 'di yin te phyi rol du phyogs skyong gi gtor ma dang mchod pa la sogs pa byas la /

analyzed: nang du zhugs te 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal zhing 'khor lo'i dbang phyug la mchod yon la sogs pa phul te /

original: dge ba yongs su bsngos la bskor ba gsum byas nas shar gyi sgor bcom ldan 'das la mngon du phyogs par 'dug ste /
analyzed: dge ba yongs su bsngos la bskor ba gsum byas nas shar gyi sgor bcom ldan 'das la mngon du phyogs par 'dug ste /

original: yi ge brgya pa brjod la /
analyzed: yi ge brgya pa brjod la /

original: nus pa med pa dag gis gtso //
analyzed: nus pa med pa dag gis gtso //

analyzed: ma rnyed pa dang ma 'tshal nas //

original: ma tshang ba dang lhag pa gang //
analyzed: ma tshang ba dang lhag pa gang //

analyzed: bgyis pa de dag bzod par 'os // sngags nyams pa dang bya ba nyams //

translated: Having requested forgiveness with this, the wisdom wheel departs with oṃ vajra muḥ and so forth and oṃ āḥ hūṃ. Also, one’s emanation wheel is meditated inside oneself.

analyzed: a'a dya nutpanna tv'ata aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
